number of helpful: 332 of 373 people (89%) found this review helpful167 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 25, 2015
												I'm not entirely sure what the aim of creating this game was. Let me explain;Nothing is explained. Why do you magically zap on to a boat? Why is the crystal on the boat? Why do you need to retrieve it in the first place from the boat and not on Xen? Why were the Xen creatures already there before the resonance cascade?Why?WHY?WHYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY?All of this is completely unanswered, but this is just the start. [Spoilers]Once you magically apear upon the boat, seemingly sent by Zeus, you pickup almost all of the weapons available in the game, instantly making it very easy. If that didn't make it easy enough for you, then you're in luck! Right in front of you is a conveniently placed helicopter, complete with a mounted machine gun, meaning all those Xen creatures are dead before you move 10 metres.Once you finally reach the main cabin, you are greeted by 3 turrets, which are easily avoidable. In fact, there are 100s of better locations for them, which would have proved challenging, however, the creators were obviously not in a creative mood, so decided to place them right in the open, however, they did take the time to ensure even spacing, which was a nice touch.Next, you are inside, where you'll reach the lift, clamber through the overhead opening, and up the tedious ladder, and eventually reach the control deck, where you're warmly greeted by 3 soldiers, seemingly oblivious to the Xen creatures which have engulfed their ship. After this, and a few random Xen creatures which magically appear, you find a man. The soldiers also seemed oblivious to him, which is surprising as he was literally next to them. The man is the most socially awkward NPC I've ever encountered, and was a walk suitable for the Ministry of Silly Walks. He opens a security coded box for you, containing a med kit. This was much needed, as the previous 20 were not quite enough. He the proceeds to open the cargo doors, containing a dangerous creature, which is obviously the best idea. On top of this, he automatically knows why you're there. No questions asked. You then need to BACKTRACK THE WHOLE MAP in order to reach the cargo hold. Of course, it should be a nice brisk walk, after all, you have just defeated all the creatures, right? Wrong. They've respawned, and in seemingly higher numbers. Once you battle your way through the Battle of Somme, you reach the cargo doors. At first, I wasn't sure what to do, as surely if I jump in I'd die? I discovered that jumping in to a gaping dark hole actually heals you, which was a nice surprise.So, the boss fight. Before anything even begins, you get to endure a lovely cutscene where the boss sucks up the crystals, which once again begs the question, why?You've spent the whole game (10 minutes) collecting all the weapons in the game, conserving your ammo, well guess what? They're all gone. You can pickup a few off the floor, but ammo is almost non-existent. The boss itself is, well... interesting. It is a down-sized and retextured version of Nihilanth, and completely lacks any form of animation. To me, it resembles a over-stuffed teddy bear, so stiff that it puts viagra to shame.  Once you've finally defeated him, (Cooked grenades seem to work well),  that's it. That's literally it. The boss shatters like if I picked up your vase and threw it on the ground. Oh and the crystals? Gone. The final credits/cutscene shows the crystals in a different location, which I can only assume is suppose to represent Black Mesa. I don't think I can truly express how underwhelming this game is. The idea of Half-Life: Before is brilliant, but this game, is certainly not brilliant.

Posted: December 3, 2013
												First of all.....what. the. hell. is. this. game? OK, when I saw the name Half-Life: Before, I thought it'd be like a game that has at least 5 ~ 6 missions like those expansion packs of the first Half-Life, but hell, was I wrong. First, story. Does not make any kind of sense. I should say there is no such thing as a story in this. A.I.....horrible. Some zombies don't even move at all, they just stand there like idiots and do nothing. And there are only a few enemies that you can kill. I still kind of remember how many there were still, 6 ~ 7 enemies + one boss. How long does it take to beat this game? 6 MINUTES. 6 FRIGGIN MINUTES, AND THAT INCLUDES WATCHING THE ENTIRE ENDING, TOO.At the beginning, I get my suit and then I fell and died, and all of a sudden I am at the place where there are those enemies. Doesn't make any sense. And then I kill all enemies, and there is a helicopter but it don't do jack **** so I just fall down, as that is the only thing you can do there and that leads to the boss fight, which is pretty ridiculously stupid. Oh, sorry, did I spoil the game. WELL GUESS WHAT, THERE IS NOTHING, I SAY AGAIN, ABSOLUTELY NOTHING TO SPOIL IN THIS.Well, at least the game is free. Yah, but AIN'T WORTH MY 6 MINUTES. Why did they make this? Were they bored like hell? I do not see the point of this game, and I do not see why this game had to be made. 1 out of 10

content:
Posted: October 25, 2014
												Ok. So. Lets imagine this was a free custom map. Nobody hates it . So then, add some custom content including a new pistol (which looks and feels worlds better than those in half life) textures for characters (or rather corpses), scripted sequences, decent music, voice acting and a second level. Now suddenly everyone hates it.Why?Now, I admit that some of the points are valid.It lags. Yes, but that's because in the setting it's raining.The amount of health kits. True, there are way to many health packs, but considering that you have to cross the deck twice, both times being attacked by the fearsome creatures of Xen, I think the developer made a fair assumtion that we would need this many.The boss. I agree. It's crap.The story. I don't think everyone has even thought about it.So. You are aparently in another dimension, yet we spawn in a flash of lightning on a boat. Does anyone remember how the xen monsters spawned? IN A FLASH OF LIGHTNING. How do you think a human would arrive? Also, the boat. Let me insert an extract from the Combine OverWiki."In addition to this legitimate research, several secret projects are also carried out at Black Mesa, which are deliberately left vague. A large amount of classified research is carried out, including the development of high-tech weapons and defense systems, research into extra-dimensional travel, teleportation, and the study of Xen."So, we already know that Black mesa have been to other dimensions-is it so far fetched that black mesa have a boat in one of these dimensions? So you travel to this dimension expecting it to be an easy collection; get the test sample and go-hence, you have no weaponry. But, you arrive and everyones dead. Xen creatures have manged to get aboard. How? we don't know You don't know Your character doesn't know nobody knows! But they are here and you have to fight them off. You eventually reach a survivor who opens the CARGO doors for you.And before i finish, i'd like to mention a great scripted event most people have probably overlooked. As you make your way over the deck, you see the gman watching you. Then, just as you get close to the point he's at, you are distracted by some turrtes. You have to destroy them, and when you look back to where the G-man was, he's gone. That's just an example.There is more I could mention, but multiple issues mentioned in other reviews have been cleared up now.If we had to pay as much as a penny for this, I would agree. But we dont. ITS FREE. No price, no problem.

Posted: August 8, 2014
												Half-Life: Before looked promising when i saw it at the steam store but sadly in the end it didn't meet up with the expectations. The encounters on the deck were easily avoidable by just running through and it didn't challenge me much other then wonder what is going on storywise. Fights became repetitive after a while that was not a good sign either.The ship map itself was nicely made however and in the 2 playthroughs i went through this game did not encounter any glitches that forced me to reload so when it comes to making maps the people who made this mod deserves some credit. The soundtrack this game had definitly deserves some credit for a job done right aswell, despite of the things this game lacked it created more tension in the athmosphere of the game. Enemy movement however leaves many desires, i encountered enemies who were unable to move properly around the place like they normally would but the final boss takes the grand prize for obvious reasons. This is not a game mod i would recommend for serious playing though it is free to download (Half-Life needed) and there is absolutely no harm in trying it out for yourself and share your thoughts about it.I give my best of luck in the future to the developers of this mod who did their best to create and publish a game mod like this. It might not be an A+ title but we all have to make a beginning somewhere.All the best!(s.i.e)

number of helpful: 64 of 71 people (90%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 4, 2013
												Looking for an interesting, well polished and fun game? This is not the place.Shorter than most single map mods I've played, Half-Life: Before is a pile of incomplete ideas strung together by a lack of design experience. It really feels as if it's a first attempt at a short story in the Half-Life universe, using Spirit of Half-Life functions in their most basic forms and having a lack of understanding of pacing and difficulty in games. Enemies seem placed only to momentarily prevent progress instead of trying to provide a challenging experience, as weapons and ammo were placed at every turn, making it almost impossible to fail as long as you managed your health.After a short stretch of gameplay that I would think of as an intro sequence to any other game, I was already facing a static model of Nihilanth merged with a generic Barnacle enemy colored white, acting as a final boss which will kill you instantly if you even hesitate after the cutscene introducing it. As long as you assume control properly after the cutscene and can circle strafe, the boss is a cakewalk, assuming you don't bump into anything and end up getting caught in its tongue. Immediately following his death, you're treated to a fly-through of a facility far more interesting than the playable area, which acts as an end-game credit sequence. When it finished, the game crashed.All in all, it's an experience best left alone. Use the half hour you save on knitting, watching the Demented Cartoon Movie, or smashing your♥♥♥♥♥♥with a hammer. All the above are more productive than the time you will spend playing Half-Life: Before.

content:
Posted: December 15, 2013
												10/10 Best Game 2013The boss fight, the quality of the graphics, it was all there. I don't think I've ever played such a puzzling game. The amount of skill required for me to open up console and type sv_cheats 1 to finish the game was huge. It was quite a puzzle to google that. Not to mention the old man that kept following me around... he puzzled me too.Overall this game was amazing. Hours and hours of gameplay, more than Skyrim as far as I remember. And it never gets old.Also this game had so much detail in its map I had to look away for a bit. The massive freight ship took hours to navigate. I almost gave up. But then I was like, NO, I MUST DO THIS. And so, after going to navigation school, I was able to do it. Then I came to the Elevator, with a capital E, because this game had a lot of purposeful typos. Speecal thanks, by the way for those. Anyways, after the elevator I met my best friend, Sir Old Man or something. Accidentally shot him and lost the game though. Then he just was like "oh thanks for waiting 10 minutes for me to open this gate" and he gave me a healthkit, which he had been saving in like a Sentry Safe for like 10 years. And then after that I walked out and jumped into a black hole which just turned into a room and the credits came in and the game was over and it crashed so 10/10 best game.This game definitely deserves a MetaScore of 102. Yes, over 100. The detail and quality of gameplay brought to me by this game was truly amazing. So much better than those other games... and it definitely beat the story of Half-Life with its gameplay. The amount of time this game has consumed is almost terrible. There were so many pros and so little cons in this game. They even managed to rig the settings menu so that I couldn't turn off the soundtrack that amazingly mixed with this game.Overall, I love this game. Although there's one thing it's missing. It needs killstreaks. With only zombies and guns, you can't have a game. You need killstreaks, zombies, and guns. It's the only way to be successful. Oh, and it needs an in-game Twitch streamer as well as YouTube uploader and editor with lens flares built in. How else can I add my amazing frag videos for this game? I've gotten so good at it.Anyways, this game was amazing. And still is. And if you haven't tried it, then you should, because you're really missing out.

content:
Posted: March 11, 2014
												Half Life:Before is an emotional journey of pain, laughs and tears. This game is really amazing and here's why.The game opens up with a cutscene, something we've always wanted in a Half Life game, and despite a big♥♥♥♥♥cutscene, we get no insight on what our goal is, who our main character is, what purpose he has in the Half Life universe, this is good because it makes the game more cinematic. As we progress through the cargo ship which is the only level in the whole game, we fight our way through vortigaunts... but wait! Isn't this game supposed to be taking place before the first Half Life? Well it is you dumb ♥♥♥♥, those vortigaunts are there to pad the game out so we can experience more of this masterpiece. But we venture further on through a poorly designed level to reach an easy elevator puzzle which I wish I could dwell on but that was way too complex that even writing more about it would hurt my brain too much for me to pass out.We then climb up the ladder and come face to face with a group of... enemy soldiers? Why are they here? How the hell should I know like I said this game is way more inticrated than you might expect. So we still get no explanation, again making it more enduring and cinematic. After we defeat three enemy soldiers we then come across an NPC. Who is he exactly? He doesn't explain himself, but in theory this stays consistent with the game's convuluted tone which is great. We then backtrack all the way to the other side of the boat again and come across more enemy soldiers and monsters who magically teleported onto the boat. After we defeat them easily like every other enemy in the game we have to take a leap of faith.  The boss battle is easily the best part of the game, another cutscene takes place showing us something that could've easily been seen by the player in a control state. He chases us around in a massive circle with an awkward idle animation. We defeat him without breaking a sweat and the game ends, and I'm not ♥♥♥♥ing around when I say this, but the effort has all been put in the end credits, I'm not ♥♥♥♥ing joking.Also the game has typos.10/10

Posted: August 19, 2015
												I normally don't make any negative criticisms, but I guess there's a first for anything. I like to point out that whoever made this mod made it too hard to play, even with the easy difficulty. I also think that the boss fight in the end is ill-conceived.Anyway, down to the story, or should I say a lack of. A character dressed in an HEV suit appears from a bolt of lightning on a cargo freighter. Also, the creator of this mod was trying to create an origin tale as to where the Black Mesa Research Facility had gotten their hands on the Xen crystal. Well, it's nice to see that you added G-Man in the beginning and end, but there's still no story. I thought the HEV suit was only worn by scientists. Scientists! This looks more like a mission for black ops! Also, who are the characters? You failed to mention that. And how did the aliens appear before the Black Mesa incident? Wasn't the crystal supposed to be the cause of their whereabouts?If anyone is going to come up with ideas involving an unofficial prequel for the first Half-Life, it should be with a clear and more explainable plot. There should be more of a narrative and a better improved development of characters. I appreciate the amount of hard work that has been done; but sadly, the effort is not enough.

content:
Posted: December 4, 2013
												I honestly can't believe this wasn't on Steam sooner. Seriously. This has to be one of the best games of this generation. After playing through it once, I went back and did a speed run. Then I went back and did another speedrun. I kept this up for about 15 hours until some family members got concerned and turned the power to the house off. It didn't matter, I had enough information about this game to keep replaying it in my head for weeks to come. Do not listen to the other reviewers. This is the only game you need (except for Half-Life 1). The graphics are like an old school throwback to the good ol' days when graphics were good. Lets talk about the story for a bit. It's like Plato, Shakespeare, the person that works at my local McDonalds, and Skrillex all came together and made this story. It'll blow your mind. You are just put into this world with a handful of Cherrios and you are forced to fight for your life and figure out the mystery of the boat and why it even exists. Last but not least are the physics. I can imagine what happened. Someone thought, "You know what, I don't like this real life physics, I like physics version 2.awesome and a half." And, you know what? I quite like it. I give this game 3 chickens out of 6 cows. Totally recommended. Also, if you thought any of this is serious, well, it isn't.

												Half-Life: Before is absolutely awful and how it possibly warranted distribution on Steam is beyond my powers of comprehension. Everything about this mod is tedious, generic, cheap, poorly designed, stupid, and generally unpleasant. The levels are poorly built and have very little in the way of cohesive structure or remotely functional Half-Life design: it's a shooting gallery, and not a very good one at that.The game places you in the shoes of "Andrew Winner", a scientist who inexplicably materializes onto a poorly built, blocky cargo ship where he kills lots of aliens to obtain some kind of an artifact that'll help Black Mesa... do something. This is objectively unfun and makes me seriously wonder if Steam's endgame of offering free and open entry to all games/mods is such a wonderful goal after all. If it results in more expansive, jaw-dropping game experiences where I play as "Andrew Winner" on a boat then I'd rather play Call of Duty for the rest of my days.In conclusion, I recommend that you be an "Andrew Winner" by not playing this horrible mess of a mod. Ever.

number of helpful: 79 of 119 people (66%) found this review helpful72 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 2, 2015
												I looked at this and wondered "How the hell does a free mod get a "Mostly Negative" user rating? It just looks like a generic single player Half-Life level."Boy was I wrong.The dialogue of the story is in awkward "Engrish". The sound design is horrible (the rain is louder than the enemies, gunshots, and music). The final boss is a Nihilanth titled horizontally with a barnacle for a mouth. Imagine a Half-Life barnacle being able to chase you as fast as snark, it's so weird you can't help but to laugh but also be disappointed at how ♥♥♥♥♥♥ it is.This mod is so bipolar. On one hand the author seems to be a very inspired Half-Life fan. He even put his favorite science fiction books in the lockers, like in the original Half-Life. I think he really enjoyed making this mod. On the other, it is not polished at all and it seems like he rushed to finish it. It's only about 20-30 minutes long. He put more effort into creating the "spacial" credits level than the two levels in the game combined.So why am I recommend that you play it still? Because it's so bad it's good. It's so weird and quirky that you can't help but to laugh but also be appalled at it's poor quality. This monstrosity something you have to experience. Also the protagonist Andrew Winner is pronounced Andrew "Weener". Weener hehe.Download this mod with the same attitude you would have buying a toothless paraplegic hooker. You know it's going to be bad, but you're still curious as hell.

number of helpful: 30 of 38 people (79%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 4, 2013
												Well. I've got to tell you that my expectations jumped real high when I saw a new Half-Life game in the Store. Turns out it's actually a Greenlighted mod. "Oh well, it's free and it's a mod for one of my favorite games, why wouldn't I try it?".40 mb downloaded later I was in the main menu of this thing. I pressed that magic "New game" button. The game starts and I see a poorly-made cinematic of a camera (that seemed controlled by a player with shaky hands) flying over a ship, to a point where there's a helicopter landed. You know, I seriously expected this to have something like that 30 epic minutes of running around in the original HL. I expected some backstory. When I saw the helicopter I thought "Hey, maybe I spawn in there". Nope, nope and nope. After the cinematic the game makes you spawn in front of the helicopter, like if you had been teleported, with no story or anything like that. Those 30 minutes in the original game made you get used to the controls. Here you don't have a single second, since as soon as you're given control of your character, a headcrab attacks you. I opened my way through the headcrab and all the zombies that were in the area in less than a minute. Comparison time again: Battles in HL were long and difficult at first because you only had a pistol and a crowbar. You were given more guns gradually and you had time to get used to every single one. As well as the enemies, they all didn't appear in the same level, within the same 10 minutes.Here 5 minutes after I started I had a gun, a rifle and a crowbar. I killed all the zombies without spending a single bullet because inside of the helicopter there was a mounted machine-gun. The kind of machine gun that you only get to see like 10 hours in in the HL campaign. The kind of machine gun that won't run of ammo, deals a lot of damage and literally makes you feel like an overpowered turret. The kind of machine gun that here I used to make my first encounter with the enemies last less than 30 seconds. I run towards and find a shotgun. Then two new enemies appear (new as in the first time they appeared in the mod). With one of them I find the alien bugs that you can throw and use as bio weapons. To get to the next part I had to solve a jumping puzzle! A jumping puzzle 10 minutes after I had started playing. Of course that new players would have no idea of how to move boxes. I only figured it out minutes after running around aimlessly, feeling like an idiot. So you're supposed to drag a box, jump from the stairs (jumping from the stairs is extremely hard, as usual) and crouch to get on top of the box, then jump even further to get on top of a container and keep on moving. How the hell is a newbie supposed to know that? There are cringe-worthy moments as well. The dev put a newspaper-like page that can be found in the floor, kind of advertising himself. On it you can read "Interview with Andrii Vintsevych. This guy is a ♥♥♥♥ing genius. You should learn how to do maps like this guy, ok?". On the outfit of the corpse you find when the mod starts you can read "L337". And there are the un-forgivable typos you'll come across while trying to play this. Seriously, at some moments it makes you worry about the mental sanity of the people you're talking with. I'll quote some: "I think it cose escape of other monsters" and "It has escape". And in the credits it says "Spacial thanks". Yes. Spacial. What you just read. I don't want to make this review much longer. You could read reviews by other people and see the same I want to tell you; I highly recommend you doing so. This is a short mod for one of the best games ever made that won't even reach the knees of HL. But of course, maybe you don't believe all of the people who are giving it negative reviews and may want to try it for yourself. It's free (if you own Half-Life) and you don't lose nothing. I'm just saying that I didn't like it and I wouldn't recommend it to anybody.

content:
Posted: October 29, 2014
												I was concerned when I saw this game in the steam library having mostly bad reviews. "Hmm," I said to myself ",a Half-Life fan-made mod that has bad reviews? Surely these reviewers are too picky." Well the picky reviewers were right, Half-Life: Before was bad. It's not like, 'unplayable' bad, or the 'spit-shine-on-game-release-shelves' bad that Call Of Duty does, it's just, bad. Creashock Studios, you could have made something cool out of this 1.5 level map (the map-count being one of the problems) but you didn't. The one thing awesome about Half-Life is everything isn't given to you in the first five seconds of game-play. As said erlier, this could have been really cool, telling the story of how the Crystal that was used in the first Half-Life game was discovered, it's power, etc. etc. AND answering the question of how the Crystal was aquired (without going to any lore videos and/or articles). Also, I was confused how Mr.Winner (I now realize why he was given that name) got onto the ship to begin with, a lighting bold hit it, and Poof, he's there. The map count could have been increased, the boss could have been more than a moveless shell with a barnicle as it's wepon, and the list goes on and on. I think what was supposed to happen is they were trying to make Half-Life a (do not quote me on this) Spunk-Gargle-Wee-Wee game, like Call Of Duty. But over-all, it was bad.

number of helpful: 51 of 77 people (66%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 18, 2014
												Oh god, I knew this was gonna be bad from the reviews, but nothing could have prepared me for this.It starts out OK enough, the camera starts in the captain's area of this nice looking cargo boat (well nice looking for HL1 anyway) in the middle of the Nonspecific Ocean, with Gman looking out towards the helipad. Fine, helipad on a cargo boat, little weird, but artistic license, right? And then once the camera gets to the helipad, you see a Zombie, a headcrab, and a bloody soldier leaning on the rail (presumably the former two wrecked him something fierce). It all looks like the soldier's gonna get up and be your player character, right? WRONG. Your player character is a guy in an HEV suit, who literally lightning bolts into existence like he's Zeus onto the helipad. Already starting to lose credibility.The guns aren't anything mentionable, just standard HL1 weapons. And as near as I can tell, standard HL1 enemies too. There's probably supposed to be another level or something where they introduce something, but get this - about five minutes into the first level, I reach a complete dead end. I've searched the entire damn level up to that point, there is absolutely no way I can advance. I can't crowbar my way around, I can't push a box and jump somewhere, there's NOTHING.However, what I could get through of this first level played exactly like those "kil al da bad guys" missions I made when I was six. Medkits every four feet, a bunch of quasi random enemies in a room, a wide complement of weapons before I've had time to sneeze, and I could see each obstacle coming from a mile away. This is something I'd introduce to a small child to get their opinion on FPS games, not something I'd play as a 20-something looking for a good time.Short version: NO.Longer version: NOOOOOOO NONONONONONO NOOONO NO.

number of helpful: 24 of 30 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 4, 2013
												It's just one of those days - AnonymousTHE GOODThis is a sad case here. The soundtrack is really very good, and while getting repetitive, it makes this game almost worthwhile. They also reskinned the pistol to make it look nicer. And the likes touches like a scientists tie swaying as he walks are cool to see. Also, the map is similar to a map in TTT, which gave me hope when starting it up, which was the only hope I got from this game. It's short, but it's better than having an 8 hour mod which takes up more time than you're willing to invest.THE GREATIf you own Half Life already (Which you do, because you are a GOOD boy who bought Half Life when it came out) then this mod is free and doesn't cost you anything.THE UGLYThis was based off the Half Life engine. That is fine. Using the same enemies, weapons and skins is less so. I would have liked to see a little more change with the weapons, the enemies, or even the skins. Sadly, most of these are just copy and pasted. The only encounter with a friend in this game is a scientist who claims to know what you want, opens a crate which contains a medkit and presses a button which allows you access to the next level. While this may have been a nice idea on paper, glitchy AI prevent you from moving too quickly, which disrupts the flow. You can open this crate and push the button faster than he can, making him redundant. And when he talks, he talks in text form. No problems here, except it is unpunctuated and misspelled. This is lazy. And then the boss. The Nihilanth plus a barnacle is NOT a good boss idea. The boss fight is a cheap idea. It scatters your weapons around the (Small) arena, drops a snark in with you and has a whole lot of ammo in a metal container which provides no escape route when cornered. And after beating him, a black screen and the entire game crashing sours the experience.THE VERDICTI do not enjoy saying that this mod is bad. I've actually had a bit of fun with it, but framerate issues and a lack of direction just makes this experience not worthwhile. Sure, it's only two levels and it's free, so there's not too much to complain about, but it feels like a waste of potential. And that really is a shame. Oh, to all of the people who hate this game so much, this was Greenlit, so a great number of you are probably to blame for this ending up on Steam. Not that it's bad that fan-made mods end up here, but some of the complaints and comments that have been said to and about the maker of this are unneeded. Cut it out guys.SIMILAR GAMES-Nothing is really very similar to this gameFor more reviews check out http://steamcommunity.com/groups/truereview

content:
Posted: July 25, 2016
												Games like this make me wonder why Greenlight even exists.Set in "another world" of the Half Life universe (which seems to be just an average ship), you play as scientist Andrew Winner, who must go to this new world to find an "artifact," as the title screen says. The story feels like some terrible fanfic, complete with a nonexistent plot and terrible grammar.The actual control/feel of the game is good, mainly because it's Half Life (aside from a few areas where you can get stuck and must reload a saved game). But don't expect anything new or exciting. The store page of this game says that there are a ton of new features, such as new levels, soundtrack, and "high definition models." After playing through this game twice, I can safely say that the store page is a gigantic lie. While it does have a new soundtrack (which is decent at best), the other new additions are barely noticeable. The "new levels" consist of going to the back of a small ship, talking to a guy with broken English, going back to the front of the ship, and having to fight the final boss from the original Half Life. The "fight" if you can call it that is just you shooting in the air while running in circles for about a minute. By the time you realize it, you'll have beaten the entire game in about 10 minutes. As for the "high definition models," they are no better than Blue-Shift's updated visuals.Of course some may argue that it's a mod, and that it isn't going to be high quality. But if you do some searching, you'll find some amazing Half Life mods that were made years before this. The fact that this even got greenlit still baffles me to this day. On the bright side, it's free, so you can at least play it just to see how bad it is.

content:
Posted: October 23, 2014
												!!SPOILERS!! THE WHOLE PLOT IS BELOW !!SPOILERS!!This game started off ok but got bad quite quick.First off you get almost every weapon in the first area. Not that bad but you also face almost every single monster in the game in the same stage.After this fight you get to the tower. In my case I was below half health. You encounter a room with 3 soldiers in it. Ok. Kill them and begin to explore the room. Now after this fight you're probably low on health. So what happens next? The room is flooded with snarks. Took me several attempts to survive.You get through that and go into a room in which you encounter the first living other person. You get the crossbow and he opens a big door. Really thinking of Jurrasic Park. Apparently theres a big scary monster in the hanger. So we open the doors.You are then forced to back track all the way to the begining. Which has magically been repopulated with aliens.You eventually reach the hanger and face a really glitchy cutscene. Which is unskippable. The "big scary monster appears" which is really a reteaxtured barnicle attached to a ragdoll of the final Half Life boss.You get into the fight and realise that you have NO weapons. They are lying around you. This means that, no matter how conservative you have been, you combat the boss with next to no ammo. The boss is not even that hard. Although if you get caught on the barnicle tounge its almost an instant kill. If you die you have to go through the cutscene again.You kill the boss and take the crystals. End of the game. Thats it. Its meant to be backstory but its just a shoot em' up. The final boss is just a bit stronger than the rest.The best bit of the game was probably the final, non glitchy, cutscene.

Posted: March 23, 2014
												Welp. Here's the deal.This Mod. Had potential.This Mod. It had decent scripting. Just enough to make you feel the game for what it is instead of guiding you thorugh the story.This Mod. It talked of going to the Black mesa complex. Of being a winner. Andrew Winner. of a special artifact.It had Weapons in it. It had new skins. It did have New Levels,a nd new textures. The ingredients for a possibly good mod- the possibility of good gameplay, and a new story.This Mod. it was not that.It took thirty eight minutes to complete. The battles were not stunning. Rather, they were forced. Rushed. It was artificial difficulty. I felt like I was playing a sea-based Half Life: Uplink (We all know that terrible movie...)This mod. There were not true puzzles. Just small "hit this and it falls over" periods.This mod. It did not have -true- new weapons. Merely reskins.It had potential.But it was not great.If you seek a small run-and-gun, then go ahead... Add this to your list of games. but if you want a true half-life style challenge... this is not it. I can only hope this is just the first part of a larger thing.

number of helpful: 10 of 11 people (91%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 20, 2013
												This is honestly the worst excuse for a "mod" I've ever had the misfortune of playing. How did this get Greenlighted again?The gameplay is mindless, the puzzles are stupidly easy to figure out and the shooting isn't really fun because you're being swarmed constantly, when you first load this game up the first thing that happens is a headcrab attacks you, the final boss is also mindless as all it does is follow you and will NEVER attack you. Oh and don't even get me started on the broken English present in this game, so many inexcusable typos such as "artefact" and misplacing the word "you'll" The soundtrack is good, but very repetitive and can be very droning after about 10 minuutes of gameplay, this is probably the only good thing about this game and the artist of the soundtrack should feel proud. It's quite reminiscent of the original Half-Life soundtrack and seeks to capture the same vibe but somehow falls flat just like the rest of the mod.Overall, the design is extremely poor and the game feels unfinished. I do not recomend this mod for anything other than showing people how not to design a video game. It also should be an example of when NOT to Greenlight a game for release. The only good thing I could think about this game is that I didn't have to pay anything for it and that I was able to finish it in around 30 minutes.

												Let me make it CRYSTAL ♥♥♥♥ING CLEAR that I am recommending this product only because it is FREE.  No other reason. But is IS FREE.  And it has gobsmackingly inappropriate "metal" music during its fiendishly♥♥♥♥♥♥poor end boss battle...which is either a plus or minus, depending on whether you're the kind of person who chooses to laugh at this sorry excuse for a world, or cry at it.  Better than several small kicks to the groin, if only by the smallest of margins.    Verdict: 5/10.

content:
Posted: December 5, 2013
												This mod is a fairly well constructed mod but it falls short on multiple areas.Before I get to those points let me discuss what it does well:1: Remodels nearly all weapons2: Nice setpiece of the boat3: Challenging, this game actually is HARD. I played it on normal and I barely survived the mod with about 14% health left.Now that I discussed how this mod is good let me discuss how it falls short:1: Little to no story. Seriously the most story you get is from the title screen. Everything else is either hidden away or non existant.2: Very short. If you are a skilled player of Half-Life you can probably breeze through this mod in about 20 min or less. The boat is the ONLY level.3: Boss fight is lackluster. Just circle-strafe the motionless (And by motionless I mean it has no animations except the grabber tongue.) Nilanth trying to get you like a Grabber and unload all of your bullets into it. Done.4: The flying enemies glitch into the sky when you kill them. Maybe this was a problem with the original HL as I have only played up till Lamba Labs.5: Box puzzle with the elevator could have been a bit more obvious as most people don't know you can grab sliding objects with their USE key. I sure didn't and that's the first time I have seen that in action and boy does it not want to go into the spot you want it to.Overall if you wanted a quick mod to breeze through mindlessly then go for it. Otherwise just don't bother as it is just lackluster.

number of helpful: 11 of 15 people (73%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 3, 2013
												While I absolutely love the idea of more GoldSrc mods being available on Steam, HL: Before is nothing but a mess. Two small, uninspired levels with no cohesive enemy placements (why do marines and aliens both want to kill you at the same time?), a couple of crate-pushing 'puzzles' so simple I wonder why they even bothered, weapons other than the shotgun being relatively useless, a choppy and inconsistent framerate (inexcusable for a game on this engine that reuses HL1 assets) and a terribly easy final boss encounter make this feel like a waste of 15-20 minutes instead of something that should be more exciting; a new HL campaign. Even little things like not being to adjust the terrible and droning in-game music volume, said music abruptly starting and stopping upon entering a new room (which really isn't necessary), and being able to see where the level stops into the skybox is very amateur and embarassing to witness. There's little-to-no polish, and it's just not worth the bother.

content:
Posted: December 5, 2013
												Mod quality: Adam.No, seriously, who thought it was a good idea bring this mod to Steam? It looks like it was done by someone new to GoldSrc:*There are three maps, when all of them can fit in one.*TOO SHORT (10 minutes, probably I could even beat it in 5 minutes).*Poor optimization, there are constant FPS drops.*Only two push crates, those can't be considered as a puzzles.*Weird scripted scenes. With more work on those, it would look better (and being a way to tell the story, don't use the background menu for that).*The mod hangs when loading the maps or the menu.*The mod uses custom content (I gonna believe they got permission for the pistol, and the rest of props are made by they), yet it doesn't use voices (If you are going to use game_info as subtitles, at least make sure it doesn't have typos!).However, the look of the ship and the credits level is good. I wanna believe that this is an incomplete mod, which their autor put it here to continue working on it (which is not an excuse), but the fact that is not even bug less, and it made it on Steam, it makes me mad. There are many legendary/excelent GoldSrc mods like They Hunger, Azure Sheep, Residual Life and many more that deserves to be here rather than this mod.

												Short Review: This is the worst HL mod ever. Avoid at all costs. Long Review: You begin the game being thrust into the world knowing absolutely nothing. Then, they throw a bunch of enemies at you and practically every weapon in Half-Life. You don't know where you are or what you're doing, and you never do. After you stumble upon the only NPC in the game that isn't trying to kill you, he quickly explains that they've created something, it went wrong, and then says something about an artifact. You jump down into the second of two maps and then this face-down Nilanth with a barnacle tongue attacks you. After you shoot it with all the weapons you were provided earlier, the game just ends without any explaination of what just happened. The ten-minute journey has absolutely none of the features the mod promises. I'm not even convinced that it occurs in the Half-Life universe, but I don't know. Complete with terribly done cutscenes.Rating: 2/10. Avoid playing.

												This mod isn't terrible,  but it certainly isn't good either.First off, it's ridiculously short. About 10 minutes through the game, you already have all of the weapons in the game. Then the game gives the ultimate "f*ck you" and takes them all away. You can pickup a few guns from the enemies, but they're useless. It takes about five shots to kill you,but for them, it can take 8 or more, and they're smaller than you! How does that make sense?Next, there are few maps. Very few. Only 2 maps exist in the game, and nothing else. It would really be nice to travel to other places in the game, but you're stuck in this dinky boat the whole time (which is somehow infested with Houndeyes and Headcrabs? What?).Then when you got everything done, you have to BACKTRACK TO YOUR SPAWN POINT AT THE VERY BEGGINING OF THE GOD DAMN MAP. You have to climb over cargo crates, kill more aliens, and get useless junk to get back to the spawn point. The aliens respawn in higher numbers, too, so good luck trying to kill all of them without dying. Then you fight the final boss...this must be good, right?No.Not even close.The final "boss" is a huge dissapointment. It's just Nihilanth with a Barnicle in his mouth and floats around, and jsut takes grenades to kill him. He isn't event hat hard to beat, he just floats in the air, like he just wants to die. And after that? The end.It's over.Just ends.I'm so happy.The best part is that you never know what happens to the crystals. Not that you would care, anyway.

number of helpful: 9 of 13 people (69%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 14, 2016
												This mod requires ownership and installation of Half-Life. This review also assumes you already own and have completed Half-Life, my review of which can be read here.Mod: Half-Life: BeforeFor the game: Half-LifeDeveloper and publisher: Andrii VintsevychReleased: 4 December, 2013Genre: First-Person ShooterCanon status: Non-canonSetting: 2003, Black Rock, the middle of the ocean, EarthSpoiler-free plot summary: Sometime before the events of Half-Life, you, Andrew Winner, are teleported onto a research vessel of Black Mesa's called the Black Rock. You are tasked with eliminating the alien hostiles and their military handlers, and to retrieve an alien crystal.Full review: Half-Life: Before is a half-hour-long prequel to Half-Life about how Black Mesa retrieved the Xen crystal. Other than that, there is no story. This mod is also incredibly easy.You've got your basic Half-Life gameplay with only a few new things:* Custom HD animations, models, skins, and soundtrack have been added.* NPCs (or the one and only non-hostile NPC in this mod) have subtitles, whereas Valve didn't give any to the NPCs in Half-Life.However, this mod is filled with more negatives than positives:* The AI of the hostile humans is incredibly dumb, not reacting when being shot or when their allies run past them or die, and only react when you're in their field-of-view.* What few "puzzles" that exist require very little brainwork. * The soundtrack, though good, plays at random, inappropriate times.* The boss is an unanimated copy of the Nihilanth from Half-Life with a Barnacle tongue that chases you around a square room.Do I recommend Half-Life: Before? No; it has very little to give to your valuable time, and there are far better mods out there on the Internet that are far more enjoyable and of higher quality.

number of helpful: 9 of 14 people (64%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 24, 2015
												While I like that there are Half-Life mods still being developed and now released on Steam (for free I might add), I'm pretty sure the only reason this is even on Steam in the first place is Greenlight. Before is short: only 3 levels long and that's including the credits. It has its good points, but it is very extremely obviously an amateur product.The plot is explained in the main menu background. It is a bit strange and laden with typos, but from what I can gather this is how Mr. Winning (presumably related to Charlie Sheen) 'acquired' the Xen crystal used in the last experiment Black Mesa would ever perform. I don't know why they'd tell him so much about it other than to inform him of how to get back to his dimension, and I think it's handled pretty damn quickly and unceremoniously, but I guess it's not an unworkable plot.I found the atmosphere mostly great, with the rain and the storm and everything. More background information/flavor about the parallel universe Mr. Winning is in and what's happening on the ship (other than CONTAINMENT TEAM and ICKY MONSTERS) would have been great, but alas I didn't find much.The music was also pretty good, the custom textures and scripted events weren't bad, and the new pistol is superb - probably one of the best things about the mod.Now, the bad news.There are some obvious graphical glitches: bodies of Controllers that you kill in the first level float in the air, and hitting certain crates with the crowbar actually colors them white. I should also mention that every level (all three of them) needed to rebuild their node graphs when I first loaded them.The game gives you a good number of weapons early on, but you don't exactly have a ton of ammo. I'd say it can't be helped considering how damn short this mod is.Not to mention that some of the ways to advance in the first level could be made more obvious, including where the weapons are lying in front of you when you first start. The first level is good aside from that - it remined me of the ship level from Counter-Strike Condition Zero's Deleted Scenes - but the boss battle is just stupid and weird: the first time I tried it, the boss just traveled through the wall and eventually the level restarted. Turns out you just have to shoot it a lot while dodging enemy attacks.After it died, the game ended and I got to see the 'Spacial Thanks' in the credits, which were otherwise nicely scripted.I'd say give this a try if you really like Half-Life and don't mind playing a seriously weird level with a great custom pistol. Otherwise, there's not much to recommend about Before in comparison to the multitudes of other, superior HL mods. I really wish there was an option between 'yes' and 'no', because I'd use it here.At least it's free.

Posted: February 14
												For a mod of Half-Life, it isn't really that good. Which begs the question: why did this mod get greenlighted on Steam instead of better Half-Life mods? We will probably never know. Since this game is so terribly short, I'm going to some up the story on this one review. I'll try to figure out and explain it as best as I can.You magically get teleported onto a boat by a lightning bolt (no, I am not kidding). After appearing on said boat, you find out that most of the crew of the boat are dead or tuned into Zombies, with other different creatures blocking your way. After killing them and getting through some weird and confusing level design, you find a man on top of the boat that's "guarded" by some sort of soldiers, who instantly attack you (why? I still don't know. As for the man, we'll just call him Bob). After "rescuing" Bob, he tells you that they (whoever "they" is) have made a "very smart genetic modified creature". He gives you a medkit and activates the cargo lift at the front of the boat that has the creature inside. You leave him and go back to destroy it. But you also have to get through one of the more stronger enemies from Half-Life, which is still pretty easy since it gives you almost all of the weapons from that game. After plowing through them, you jump into the cargo lift which triggers an unskippable cutscene (which is gonna be very repetitive since everytime you die from the boss, you have to sit through this cutscene over and over again). The cutscene shows the "very smart genetic modified creature" eating some sort of yellow crystal. The yellow crystal might have been the artifact that Bob was talking about while you were talking to him. But why does the creature eat the artifact? I STILL DON'T ♥♥♥♥ING KNOW! After the cutscene, you are greeted with both the first and final boss of this game, the creature. The boss is... interesting. It's the same final boss of the original Half-Life only smaller, has an instakill attack, and spawns Snarks. I found a glitch where the boss kept going through the walls and didn't attack me at all. Anyway, he is kinda easy to take down aside from the instakill attack. After killing him, you are greeted with the credits. And that's it.I got this game because I was curious, and it was for free. If you wanna try it out, then go ahead. However, if you don't wanna waste your time, then just don't bother.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 19, 2014
												I'll make this short. You start off dropped in with no backstory at all, and you are instantly given all the good weapons like a rich kid that gets what he wants when he wants. There are two levels, TWO LEVELS. The whole game is about 200mb bigger than half life according to steam, so why is it so big when it holds TWO LEVELS?! So the game boasts about having "HD Graphics", nothing is HD about them, sure a model looks cleaner but that does not make it HD. The game also boasts about having "Intense action", you know whats really intense? Jumping on boxes while trying not to fall off, real intense. I had to restart numerous times because my autosave would save while I was stuck under a staircase, or it would save when I had no health and if I moved my toe I would be killed. The review by City17.ru says that it will "appeal to people who like high challenge". First, work on your grammar. Second, high challenge? Are you joking right now? The only thing hard about this game is deciding if you should play it or not. I got stuck on the elevator part where there's a ladder on the side of the wall, but how am I supposed to see it when it blends into the background? I honestly thought it was just part of the background before I figured out that it was a ladder. The people who made this game could work on their grammar, also the guy being held prisoner could just grab the crossbow right next to him and kill everything aboard the ship. The final "boss" is a poorly retextured barnacle that is made to look white, it also has a Nihilanth model pasted over it. To beat it, you shoot the barna- I mean, Nihilanth in the mouth and then it explodes. The model was so badly pasted over that the "Nihilanth" glides around like a sloth on its belly on a very slippery patch of ice. I was really looking forward to this mod since I had never played it before and it looked pretty good, if anyone asks me if they should play this I'll give them a simple one word answer: Don't. EDIT: Turns out that the game is actually 69mb.

Few of the stupid things I've noticed:- if you shoot the guy you find on the bridge (who is apparently a ventriloquist), he won't die, but you will still get the "mission failed" message, even though he's needed only to push a button, an action which the player character could've done by himself;- the boss  is just a HL1 final boss, facing the ground, with an instakill attack, moving at ridiculous speed, the only technique to defeat him being running backwards in little circles, at the same time shooting at him from all the few weapons you have;- the said boss has a poster of himself on a wall in the first level;- at the begining of both (!) playable maps in the mod you get attacket by enemies almost immediately after opening cutscenes without a chance of avoiding damage;- during the credits, the author misspelled "Special"...

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8, 2014
												Alright. It's pretty much been established that this is a crappy mod. So I'll just write in my two cents here.It's crap. Dunno how it got greenlighted. It was on Reddit's /r/HalfLife a couple months ago and a few people back there (Me included) thought it looked good, so I guess a few people voted for it. Well, that's a mystery that may never be solved. At any rate, the only things this mod has going for it are some decent custom weapon skins and animations and a killer soundtrack. I'm a huge sucker for custom skins and anims in mods so that scored it a couple brownie points. My musical tastes lying in the metal persuasion also made me view this mod in a slightly more positive light. Otherwise, there is a STAGGERING lack of enemies in this mod. I'd count maybe somewhere from 40-50 enemies total. There are two playable maps (Unless you console command yourself into the credits map for whatever reason, which seems to be a slightly modified HL1 Sector C), and playtime is about 30-45 minutes. The boss is ridiculously strange, and also ridiculously easy to defeat, and the programming as a whole is pretty terrible. (Seriously. They programmed you to lose all your weapons at the end of the first map and get them ALL back with a set amount of ammo in the second immediately afterwards. Did they think you'd have exhausted all your ammunition on the few enemies there were?)Anyways, my recommendation? Play it if you want. But otherwise I'd say just download it, rip the model files and the music for your own enjoyment, and leave this thing to rot in the recesses of Steam's underground where nobody goes and nobody knows.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2013
												...how did this get through Greenlight again?It's basically not much more than a custom HL map, yet touted as a full-fledged modifidcation. Even if it's treated as the former, the abrupt start, overuse of surprise scares, lack of spelling consistency, and mediocre boss battle - not to mention how absurdly short this compilation is - make this a poor showcase of a map. Despite it trying to present a side-story, it seems to be poorly connected to the original Half-Life (the Gman and some Xen stuff are the only connections), and merely uses its name to draw in players.Devs should definitely think this over, possibly even ditch this current iteration entirely, if they intend on continuing this idea.

												funny review:an absolutely amazing game! so much work has been put in (to the credits sequence) that it would have taken me 5 whole minutes to do it myself! this amazing mod (it's so amazing it should be standalone) features:mega high-def models for 1 gun taken straight off of someone else's work!no storyline!a record of ONE map!30+ hours campaign!magic horizontally teleporting water!the ability to get all the weapons within 5 minutes of playing!pearfect speling!a magic man with the abilities to: communicate words telepathically into your mind while talking, open futuristic boxes and address critical injuries just by poking, and teleport by loudly screaming!and crashes the game for you!this is a must have for anyone who has chronic bad decision making!serious review:not very good. i mean, its good-ish for a russian mod, but overall pretty bad. you get nearly all the weapons straight away, there is only one map, and no story. the download for the steam version is somehow 12x bigger than the moddb download. the boss requires little skill to defeat. you just go in circles and shoot it. and the credits look much more interesting than the game! i want to play the credits instead! i give it a six because it's not bad like some other mods, but still not very good. it's worth giving it a shot though, you might like it.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 18, 2014
												You run the game. Title screen shows. What's this? The "story", already? With typos? But, a title screen shouldn't ruin a game, right?So, you press new game, and choose your difficulty. And boy, all of them are the same. Starting it is a mistake you will never undo.So, you see a cutseen, and it seems to be on a boat. The game is so bad that you won't even remember most of it.The camera shakes towards (yes, it shakes) what appears to be a solier, but in a blue-ish uniform. Okay. You think that you will play as the soldier, right? Nope. You instantly ZAP into existence, with little explanation (tittle screen) of what just happened.You are then attacked by a headcrab. What's this? You also have guns? Then you kill it. Wait, why are there aliens? Isn't this supposed to be before the incident? Paralell universe or not, this doesn't make any sense.You navigate the boat, only to reach... Sentries? Why are there soldiers? You defeat them, and go into this tower thing.Wait... what? A puzzle? Oh joy! But, it is... well... a joke. Just move a box to get up the hatch in an elevator, climb a ladder, and see... Soldiers? You defeat them, but then, SNARKS come and attack you! The only possible thing to do here is enable sv_cheats 1, and godmode. Then, you see this scientist, who only talks in text. Oh boy. Then, he activates something, which then goes into a (short) cutseen. So, you go the other way, and suddenly there are aliens. Once you do all of that, you fall into a black pit. Next level. Then, a NIHILANTH, with a barnacle thing starts to eat a crystal. You kill it, and BAM! Endgame. Oh, and did I mention that there's a (♥♥♥♥♥♥) soundrack playing, which you can't turn off? What about the climax? The credits. Simply.Good game if you want to blow some time, but seriously, even that time is wasted.Overall:Story:0/10Soundtrack:1/10Mod:0.0000000000000000000000000000000000000001/99999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999Free or not, this mod is so horrible, that 40 mb + free is a waste.DO NOT GET EVER OMG

content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
SpoilersThis game had potential. It had potential. First few points. This game is short with 2 levels, this game isn't hard on hard. Don't think there were any new models apart from the pistol? (I'll have to check that) and the marrines wearing blue. The bugs. In between the creates and the railings I got stuck. The second level doesn't load from a save. The boss didn't die the first time and flew through walls also I noticed that the game crashed around the credits and when I quit.(Beta test!).The music. It wasn't bad as far as repetitive music goes, I mean it's up from melodies.The effects. He lightning bolted onto the boat, he then returned by pressing a button on his suit. Really.... from a parallel  world, handy that. At least make us fight to the portal or something more elaborate. It felt like more work went into the credits than the game its self.The story. One thing I did wonder about was what made this a parallel world? there was such a big chance for a story there, I noticed the name of the ship "Black Rock" which I guess is the Black mesa in the parallel world. Maybe the ship was the Borealis but belongs to Black Mesa in the parallel world or am I creating the game I want to play? A acceptable story can save a game from its other flaws but sadly not here.Out of 10 I would say about 0.75. Sorry but I've seen better designed maps on Team Fortress Classic and Sven Co-Op than this game/mod. If Creashock-studios make any more Half Life mods/games please focus if nothing else on the story.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 5, 2013
												This feels more like a tech demo than a final release. The level design is good, offering clear goals and a mostly believable environment, while the new graphical elements and clever use of an enhanced physics engine help to modernize the experience and make the game feel fresh and original. It is far too short, however, and offers little in terms of replay value: most players will finish it in under an hour. The difficulty is low, the story is almost indecipherable, and I had to restart the level several times due to an assortment of game-breaking bugs. Better writing, and much more careful attention to plotting, pacing, and play-testing would help this release immeasurably. It’s a strong concept, but one that clearly isn’t ready for front page promotion on steam. Give it a miss, for now.

content:
Posted: July 30, 2014
												...it had good music at least...Honestly, this is just an odd mod.Plot:Legitimately speaking I think you play as a scientist who needs to get another something and the whole Half-Life thing happens on a ship because of some radiation [?].Gameplay:Remember those cool HL corridors and DOOM-style gunning?Did you enjoy that?Because its not here.You are basically shooting at either a bunch of enemies that pose no threat or a bunch of high-powered enemies.The guns are a bit skinned (well the Glock/M9 is...) and aliens are (for some reason) fighting along-side the military (?).Overall:Ok so it was bad, but it was honestly fun bad.  It wasn't what was expected, but I was smiling through the entire thing, it was better than people make it sound at least.I'm recommending this if you had a stressful day and need something to just smile at (yeah, its that funny)... but please don't play this if you wanted an immersive experience because you won't get it here...Its free... if I paid for this, I'd be suing left and right.  Yes, I wasted 30 minutes, but it was of my own accord.Download at your own risk... Overall it was fun, not good; it had some nice elements, but overall they were overshadowed by its problems.  Then again you can't go wrong with a free mod...... but, hey it had good music at least.~ Jason

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2013
												As a supporter of the Half-life universe I accept any addition to the Half-life family. In my opinion add-ons such as blue shift, opposing force, and decay were great games that helped to explain the world of black mesa. This game however does not deserve to be a part of this series or have anything to do with it. Besides the basics complaints such as bugs, freezings and crashes that are experienced by the game, this game fails to provide any sort of decent backstory (aka the purpose of this mod due to it being a prequel to the game "Half-life") and it is a failed attempt at an idea that could have been better executed. The idea of some kind of conspiracy in black mesa that deals with Zen before the events that occured is highly possible and it should be considered but... the clear sign of sloppy work and rushed game design prove to be this game's downfall. While basic game elements are avaliable allowing the player to progress through the game and.... "Story" .....I constantly find myself confused due to having no real motives for my actions in the game, something that I have experienced in all Half-life add-ons. Overall this game attempted something that seemed great in one's mind but failed to fully materialize into a proper story and was even further hindered by the skills possesed by the modder. Hopefully in the future this mod can serve as a purpose to be an inspiration to make a better game that actually cooperates with the black mesa universe allowing it to be worthy of being called a Half-life game.

content:
Posted: December 14, 2014
												Honestly, I expected better. It was way too short, being literally two maps long.I also don't like how it forces you to use the 'HD' models which I sincerely hate. I'd much rather play a classic game and/or mod for that game with its original style, not some supposedly 'higher quality' component to it.You basically start off with all of the guns in the game, and it doesn't present a challenge whatsoever thanks to that. The boss, what appears to be some kind of mini-boss from HL1's ending, is far too easy. All you have to do is shoot, shoot, shoot, dodge, shoot. Perhaps if a little more effort was put into making this, I'd give it more appreciation. I literally beat it in about 20-25 minutes on the first try. I might even find a small mod like this excusable if it was released earlier, but this was made in 2009, 10-11 years after HL1 was released.

content:
Posted: January 22, 2014
												Jimminey Crickett.........If because of the title you think this is a prequel or has any relation to the original Half Life, think again. Never have I ever seen a ♥♥♥♥♥ier mod. This is a salt-in-the-eyes insult to the modding community and the team behind this should be embarrsed. There is no story, generic "kill everything that moves" gameplay, takes 15, no, 10 minutes to beat and it all takes place in just two small areas that wouldn't even pass as Sven Co-Op maps. Even the end boss (if you can call it that) is terrible. It's literally a dead Alien Controller model superimposed as Nihilanth with a barnacle sticking out of it's chest that follows you constantly at your own movement speed and will kill you in 2 seconds if you stop moving at all. I'm pretty sure the end cutscene took more work than the entirety of the mod itself. The only redeeming feature is the okay soundtrack. I'll be honest, It's not the worst thing in the history of ever, but it's brutally bad. How the ♥♥♥♥ did this get on Steam, again?

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 15, 2014
												This has to be worst Half-Life (GoldSrc) mod to have ever existed! Where to begin? Well, let's say this barely has a story at all, it is just a map... and that's it! You have to navigate the sub-par half-a$$ed aforementioned map killing some numbed Xen monsters and a couple of insufferably under-trained soldiers. In it, you are supposed to retrieve a crystal, but little to no context is offered about its relevance to the Half-Life story arc, so a more proper name for this would be: "Toilet Flush: Before". To top it all it has two incredibly annoying flaws:1. Its ear-jarring generic soundtrack cannot be muted, so you will have to cope with this migraine inducing cacophony, which is not only excruciatingly annoying, but also drowns the environmental sounds and effects through most of the "story". 2. It is so poorly graphically implemented that it will stutter non-stop and make your computer feel like it is running Crysis 3 on max settings... How is that even possible? GoldSrc games are supposed to run smoothly on freaking netbooks!I know you should not look a gift horse in the mouth, but it is difficult not to do so if the horse has "Predator" like teeth and constantly bites you in the face!

Posted: December 4, 2013
												Ok, to start things off it makes no sense. There is this, well, crystal thing that the 'Black Mesa' researchers have and for some reason I have to stop this Nihilanth-Baracle mix from stealing the crystal. It has subtitles that are meant to go with audio clips that don't play. It may be a bug for me though. Also with the subtitles they have some spelling erors. like a missing capital letter   or full stop What you're meant to do is very unclear, it is mainly pushing boxes and killing enemies. It only lasts about 10 minutes. Including the 'cutscenes'. There is even a tripmine half way through that you cannot destroy yourself, so you have to crouch jump over.Overall this mod is too unclear on what it is meant to be doing. The story is terribly bad and is not clear. Even for big Half Life fans it wouldn't be good.

content:
Posted: December 7, 2013
												The game itself is short and not that great.  It just drops you in to the game with no clear objective unless you read the description on Steam.  There were some typos, and if they were natively english, then they need to go back to Kindergarten.  I would not recommend this game if you are expecting hours of content as it took me about 10 minutes, although it is good if you are bored and just want a quick action game before you leave for work or whatever.  The only thing I liked about this game was it's music.  The boss I don't consider a real challenge unless you are stupid enough to stop moving.  It is a one-hit kill boss, and like I said don't stop moving, they give you plenty of ammo to take it out thankfully.  But again I would not recommend this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 22, 2014
												Jimminey Crickett.........If because of the title you think this is a prequel or has any relation to the original Half Life, think again. Never have I ever seen a ♥♥♥♥♥ier mod. This is a salt-in-the-eyes insult to the modding community and the team behind this should be embarrsed. There is no story, generic "kill everything that moves" gameplay, takes 15, no, 10 minutes to beat and it all takes place in just two small areas that wouldn't even pass as Sven Co-Op maps. Even the end boss (if you can call it that) is terrible. It's literally a dead Alien Controller model superimposed as Nihilanth with a barnacle sticking out of it's chest that follows you constantly at your own movement speed and will kill you in 2 seconds if you stop moving at all. I'm pretty sure the end cutscene took more work than the entirety of the mod itself. The only redeeming feature is the okay soundtrack. I'll be honest, It's not the worst thing in the history of ever, but it's brutally bad. How the ♥♥♥♥ did this get on Steam, again?

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 15, 2014
												This has to be worst Half-Life (GoldSrc) mod to have ever existed! Where to begin? Well, let's say this barely has a story at all, it is just a map... and that's it! You have to navigate the sub-par half-a$$ed aforementioned map killing some numbed Xen monsters and a couple of insufferably under-trained soldiers. In it, you are supposed to retrieve a crystal, but little to no context is offered about its relevance to the Half-Life story arc, so a more proper name for this would be: "Toilet Flush: Before". To top it all it has two incredibly annoying flaws:1. Its ear-jarring generic soundtrack cannot be muted, so you will have to cope with this migraine inducing cacophony, which is not only excruciatingly annoying, but also drowns the environmental sounds and effects through most of the "story". 2. It is so poorly graphically implemented that it will stutter non-stop and make your computer feel like it is running Crysis 3 on max settings... How is that even possible? GoldSrc games are supposed to run smoothly on freaking netbooks!I know you should not look a gift horse in the mouth, but it is difficult not to do so if the horse has "Predator" like teeth and constantly bites you in the face!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 12, 2014
												Really? you push this crap to steam? I remember when back in the day, "spiritual successor" of half life were fully fleshed out episodes with 15+ maps, done with good level design at hand and tricky (sometimes) puzzles. And what is this♥♥♥♥♥♥ You run down the ship, you run back, you kill so called "boss". That's all. 8-10 minutes worth of time at max. And you push this short♥♥♥♥♥map as "official" steam release, supported by trailer? Like seriously? Hell even today Doom community has fully fleshed episodes, even with cutscenes,  (thanks to Zdoom engines and their deviraives like Zandronum (ex Skulltag)), some with dialogue routine (thanks to Strife dialog system), and modded up the butt with custom graphics, weaponry and sometimes game mechanics. Those worth far more. Why does those don't get blowed up steam release? Is it perhaps that there's such thing as humble-ness and authors don't want to ♥♥♥♥♥ themselves up by such mediocre means? Now, don't get me wrong - if something done good and it has it's potential - i'm fine with that - Action Doom 2 was a fantastic total conversion, and it deserved that large fame and spotlights.This thing does not. Because  Half-Life: before is a short, regular, mediocre and boring half life map which wrapped in stand-alone "build" with loud words like "spiritual successor". Ha. haha. hahahahahahahahah. Funny. P.S. come to think of it, i should probably revive my Total conversion idea of turning hl:s into contra force sequel, if steam gives such mediocre projects spotlight - maybe i have a good chance too...or maybe, just maybe I need to think about consequences of such time-waste and concentrate on delivering real entertainment products which have better features standing for them.

content:
Posted: February 16, 2014
												What the hell.2 "levels" and the entire game lasts maybe 10 minutes, 15 if you really stretch it out. The level design is pretty bad. I mean, I seriously had to look up a walkthrough for one part about 5 minutes in because there is absolutely no hint in the level that tells you you're supposed to move a crate into an elevator. And the story... what story? It explains nothing, and it makes absolutely no sense. How are there even monsters if the resonance cascade hasn't happened yet!? HOW ARE THERE HEADCRABS!? HOW DID NOBODY AT THE MAIN FACILITY KNOW WHAT THE HELL WAS GOING ON? WHERE DID THE MARIENS COME FROM AND WHERE DID THY GO!? The music the devs chose is also just plain obnoxiously loud to the point of drowning out all in-game audio.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 1, 2014
												(Edit: Not sure if this is happening for anyone else, but it claims I have spent no time on this game at all. This was also the case for Alpha Prime. I have spent exactly 21 minutes on Half-Life: Before, but the Steam Reviews don't want to show it.)Just take a look at the amount of time I spent playing this game. You might think, "Wow, not even an hour through it? He must not have liked it".An alternative reaction would also go along the lines of, "Wow, he barely played the game, why is he writing a review? Nerd."Believe it or not, I have beaten the game.When this mod was released, I marvelled that more brilliant HL mods were being released -- single-player ones, even more so! However I was sorely disappointed when I had used nothing but the pistol on the last boss that really took 21 minutes to get up to. The boss was deadsimple, as well, and only took about 30 seconds (if that) to kill.It's basic Half-Life gameplay, nothing new (other than gun models and all, which are alright), there's nothing that this mod changes. The level flow isn't something I'd call fascinating and I wish there were more levels than the cargo ship and the boss room.Overall, I don't recommend this game at all, but if you're bored or you really want to try Half-Life mods, give this one a quick whirl -- oh, and believe me, it will be quick!
