number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 10, 2014
												The Good - Its Free! Some of the characters models such as the Zombies and Marines seem to be improved from their originals. I especially like the Zombies chest mouth that moves and has a tongue. The weapon models for the Assault Rifle and Pistol are well done. Sound effects are classic Half-Life.  The Bad - Insultingly short; At the time I'm writing this review, I've blown through the game twice in under 30 minutes (medium & hard difficulties). The soundtrack has one good song, and the three others are range from forgettable or ear rapingly awful. The last boss fight is atrocious; you walk in a circle looking up and continuously fire your weapons and you win. The controls seem too slippery; though this is common complaint from the original Half-Life, but this mod seems to make it worse. There's a certain spot in the game that it's extremely difficult to dismount a ladder to get into a room, I consistantly jumped over the platform or landed on the plaform and slipped off to fall to my death. For calling itself "Half-Life: Before" and supposed to cover events before the Black Mesa incident, it has absolutely no story. You're teleported onto a cargo ship, you kill some aliens, and then some guy tells you to kill a "GENMOD", you backtrack to the beginning and kill it.. Done. As a last point; the game doesn't even shut down properly. You press "Quit" and it hangs indefinitely at the main menu screen until you open Task Manager and close it down manually.. OVERALL - I do not recommend this to anyone, even Half-Life fans. There is very little to enjoy from playing this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 14, 2014
												Well, here's the rundown.You are Thor, God of thunder. You flash onto the ship of dreams looking for your hammer or somthing and you immediately get all of the guns in HL1. "This weaponry is of crap" said Thor out loud for all of the zombies to hear. The zombies were displeased, and started attacking. He charged through the ship until he came across the most difficult thing ever seen in a videogame. Three turrets that shoot pure death. "Silly rabbit, trix are for kids" said Thor as he pranced all around like a ballerina until he came across an elevator. "I have the power of lightning at my side, but I might as well just push boxes." So he pushed boxes around for 10 minutes untill he came across a scientist. "There is scary monster!" Scientist exclaimed at the top of his lungs "Save me oh honorable Thor!" "No" Thor replied then he proceeded to backtrack throughout the ship because his wig fell off or somthing and he fell down a cargo hold where he found a giant baby eating a questionable urine-colored crystal using only his tounge. "That's impressive" said Thor. The baby proceeded to float towards him in a very un lady like fashion. Thor was offended by the baby's foolishness so he decided to ctrl+alt+delete out of there out of pure disgust, then uninstall the game. Thus ends the story of Thor.Honestly, all jokes aside, I appreciate what you guys were trying to do here. I understand that you were trying to capture the heart of somthing that we spent hours playing years ago. Even though I really liked the idea, The way the game was executed was a dissapointment. This had so much potential. With Black Mesa coming out sometime soon (hopefully) it would have been nice to go "back in time" and play somthing new that ran on the good ol' half life 1 engine. But, sadly no. I honestly feel bad for anybody who was really exited for this. I would really like to see you guys make somthing good in the future.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 13, 2014
												You see those screenshots up there? Next to the description of the game? Take a look at that last one, pay close attention to it. Take in every detail, every aspect, of that screenshot.THAT'S NOT EVEN IN THE MOD.The problem with Half-Life: Before is that it's just too short. FAR too short. As in "I finished the game before I finished my drink" short. As far as I can remember, there is only ONE level change in the entire game, and that level change is only there to trap the player in the (frankly terrible) boss fight. Worse still, barring the aforementioned boss fight, you literally have to do a u-turn and retrace your steps ALL THE WAY TO THE STARTING POINT.The story of the game is also quite poorly thought out, as little as there is, which makes the whole thing seem like just an extra level that was cut from the original game. Despite the steam page stating that "You're playing as a Black Mesa scientist Andrew Winner.", this is NEVER brought up in-game, and you could just as easily be Lord-High Sherrif Mafia-Don Charlie McFidget Pickle-Eyes VII and it would make NO difference whatsoever. Also, you never have to "enter another world to find an artifact", unless the developers consider "another world" to be the tiny, enclosed cargo deck of a ship.This feels like a demo - a tech demo, even - for something bigger that was never quite finished. While HL:B has polish, there's a difference between polishing a gigantic statue and polishing a tiny fork.

content:
Posted: February 16, 2014
												Blew me away. Half-Life: Before retells the final years of Caligula's rule over Ancient Rome, however, adds a modern-day twist, causing the game to be truly unique. The game's story truly proves itself to be the Citizen Kane of gaming (Eat your heart out, The Last of Us), forcing the player into moments where he can make decisions that can affect his entire life, both in the game and in real life. The game also sports a fantastic, emotion-filled cast of characters that are all incredibly written, and feel as if they're all living and breathing people, like the player. The player bonds with the characters and shares their emotions. The gameplay for this game is simply Shakespherean in its breadth, featuring hundreds of hours of diverse and unique gameplay, and is simply too good to summarize in a single Steam review. All of this is topped with an excellent soundtrack, making music from ex-legends such as Beethoven and Jesper Kyd sound like old, broken lawn mower. Everything about this game is perfect. The part when Caligula orders the player's brother to be executed still sends shivers down my spine. GOTY all years. Please download this game.

												whell dont get you're hopes up. this game is nothing but short. i would guess there is about 20ish enemies in this mod.on my first playthru the game crached and i had to start over. overall it took me about 12 minutes on my ''first'' (1.5) run counting with how long i got on my first run. looking for secrets and so on. the level design is not so bad, tho its a bit ''clunky'' and does not feel so fluid at all times. for the first puzzle you dont even need the two boxes that you are given.  this game is easy and really short. ive tried it at all difficulties, and whell on hard ive only died 5 times.the story is really short. and its way to easy to do things. right away when you spawn you are atacked by a headcrab, thats nice. feels like a oldschool shooter. but after that you can just jump into the shopper right next to where you started, and go on a full rampage on every enemy infront of you. the only ''hard'' part. was to get thru the turrets in my first playthru.you dont get a lot of ammo, insted you get a ''lot'' of weapons, tho you dont really need to use all of them. the boss is nothing but easy to beat. just run and shoot him.this game made me not stand up from my pc and scream of joy.  but for being sutch a short mod, its pretty fun. tho way WAY to easy. but if you have Half-Life on your steam acc, and havent gotten around to try it.then you might want to try this mod. as it gives a small (werry small) feeling of how half-life feels. tho only in the shooting.did i like this game? Yes, and sadly no.score: 4/10

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 14, 2014
												I would like to be among the voices of positive dissent and say that this game has been given an unfair shake by many people here. You'd think by the "Mostly Negative" reception it's a broken, unplayable mess or something. No, the fact of the matter is that it's just a really short campaign (that could be said to be just a glorified map pack) using the same weapons and enemies as usual from Half-Life and with a hilariously tossed-together end boss fight. So, in short, it's Blue Shift all over again, only it's his much younger, shorter ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ cousin (though Blue Shift didn't have a boss fight) we're dealing with here. I did like Blue Shift though, and in general after playing through the honestly exhausting campaigns that were the original Half-Life, the great Opposing Force and even Blue Shift to some degree it's nice to play a small chaser like this that focuses on its action from the getgo without fussing over length or annoying platforming sections.So the game is intended as a fan's interpretation as to how the yellow crystal that caused the Black Mesa disaster was obtained in the first place. It's been found on a cargo ship of sorts when it's taken over by the Xen aliens killing everyone, Now it's up to you, another mute, hazard suit-bearing superscientist badass named Andrew Winner (so literally you can say "YOU'RE WINNER!" in this case) to be teleported to the ship and retrieve the "artifact" in question. The moment you start a headcrab attacks you, with an assault rifle over a corpse behind you to take care of it. And from then on, it's Zombies, Vortigaunts, one part with three annoying turrets (when aren't they annoying?), Houndeyes, Bullsquids, all your favorites, before you face tougher foes like the Alien Grunts and Alien Controllers (which can be safely ignored really) getting in your way. One part has a bunch of snarks busting out of a vent shaft which is an instant death trap if you don't get back on the ladder that got you there to begin with (I don't know if it's triggered by going near it or by defeating the other enemies in the room first). Oh, yes, you face off against some... military guys. All four of them They use Marine skins but they don't seem to be Marines. I don't know who they are or why they want you dead. Are they some special ops team tasked with retrieving the artifact for their own gain, destroying it, etc.? Like I said this is before we even get to the Black Mesa debacle so hostile human presence doesn't make sense here, story-wise. Anyway, the entire game is a relatively small, extremely linear cargo ship whose structure is going from point A to B and then A again where you face off against the boss, end game. You have to get to the captain who's holed himself up in a room at the top of the ship and get him to open up the cargo hold under the ship where the yellow crystal is. Then it's another firefight against your more deadly opponents until you face off against... "Genome" Blah-blah Number-Such-and-such aka "Nihilanth with a Barnacle for a mouth." It's one of the silliest boss fights ever. First you drop down the cargo bay, where you recover some of your health somehow, and also lose all your weapons, which you have to run around the arena to retrieve again(?). The boss has no animation to it whatsoever, it's like a Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade float of Nihilanth chasing you around with a long tongue dangling on the ground (avoid the tongue or it's instant death). Where's the yellow crystal? He comes right in the bay in a  cinematic and... swallows it up with his tongue. Why? Just... because. All you do really is circle-strafe non-stop firing up at him as he floats around trying to get you with his tongue. It doesn't take long to finish him off really. I filled him with some magnum bullets, a few bullets from an assault rifle, a grenade shot and he exploded instantly... exactly like a balloon would. Oh yeah there's Alien Controllers above trying to fire at you but they're of no consequence since you're moving around so much they can't exactly hit you so they're not worth the bother. You get a cutscene where we see Gordon Freeman walk into a room where the yellow crystal is, and we know the happy fun times that comes afterwards.So, why do I recommend this game besides being short and free (which isn't really a reason to recommend anything, plenty of bad things are short and free)? Well, it's still Half-Life, it plays as such, and so it still fun and plays well. I like the tighter action focus here, a good break from Half-Life and its expansions' labyrinths, platforms and fetch quests. The action makes for a good coffee break on Medium difficulty, and somewhat challenging on Hard (this is the only Half-Life anything I've bothered with on Hard only because of the length - the other games were exhausting enough on Medium in my opinion), and though I did die a decent number of times most of those were from the turrets, the one REAL pain the♥♥♥♥♥on Hard (everything else is either just a minor inconvenience or something you can easily plow through, like the slow-moving Zombies). I like the sharper textures of the graphics and generally smoother, faster animation (it says to use the "Half-Life 1.8" engine, whatever that is) and little things like the new model and animation for the pistol. And the music too. The Half-Life games offered plenty of quiet moments in between its brief bits of moody music, here it offers more thumping electronic music that doesn't let up. It starts off with a catchy mid-paced track and for a brief time some nice techno/d'n'b for the section fighting the military dudes (too bad that doesn't last too long). The level design isn't the most amazing, it's just a stretched-out corridor essentially but for a cargo ship it gets the job done.I'd say if you're a Half-Life fan, haven't played this and wondering if you should bother I'd say yes, go ahead and form your own opinion on it. Like I said if nothing else it's short, free and very much playable with no bugs or game-breaking glitches that I could see. So now that you know that, what you think of the rest of the game is up to you.

												Not as bad as some people make out. Defintely could do with polish, and the final boss insta death seemed a little unfair, but for a short free mod you can't really go wrong. Couple of different enemies and weapons keeps some variety and standard Half-Life box pushing puzzles throughout.I feel that if the developer had spent some more time on the mod and expanded the story, it may have been a lot better.

												It's good to see a Half Life mod going on Greenlight, but when people played it...WHAT THE ♥♥♥♥? The game was short and blatantly there are bad grammar, the infamous quote "You should to be careful" has failed epically! "artefact"oh dear...why Valve?Story: 5/10 - The story is short, you just start off with a medium level in which you kill the monsters, then try to get inside, then fight the final boss of Half-Life 1 which is the same, but with vomiting...a stick?Controls: 10/10 - The controls are same than Half-Life.Graphics: 4/10 - The description of the game told there was high quality textures, instead the game offered low quality models like in the original Half-Life, what a liar! The grammar is also lame.Music: 10/10 - The music is somewhat good for me, this is the only thing i like from this game.Gameplay: 6/10 - Like i said, the story and gameplay is short and it also same than Half Life. Difference there's one puzzle which you have to push the boxes to make the stairs.Total: 3.5/5If you would like to try out this game, try this then, but i assume you that this game is gonna suck.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2014
												whell dont get you're hopes up. this game is nothing but short. i would guess there is about 20ish enemies in this mod.on my first playthru the game crached and i had to start over. overall it took me about 12 minutes on my ''first'' (1.5) run counting with how long i got on my first run. looking for secrets and so on. the level design is not so bad, tho its a bit ''clunky'' and does not feel so fluid at all times. for the first puzzle you dont even need the two boxes that you are given.  this game is easy and really short. ive tried it at all difficulties, and whell on hard ive only died 5 times.the story is really short. and its way to easy to do things. right away when you spawn you are atacked by a headcrab, thats nice. feels like a oldschool shooter. but after that you can just jump into the shopper right next to where you started, and go on a full rampage on every enemy infront of you. the only ''hard'' part. was to get thru the turrets in my first playthru.you dont get a lot of ammo, insted you get a ''lot'' of weapons, tho you dont really need to use all of them. the boss is nothing but easy to beat. just run and shoot him.this game made me not stand up from my pc and scream of joy.  but for being sutch a short mod, its pretty fun. tho way WAY to easy. but if you have Half-Life on your steam acc, and havent gotten around to try it.then you might want to try this mod. as it gives a small (werry small) feeling of how half-life feels. tho only in the shooting.did i like this game? Yes, and sadly no.score: 4/10

												Half-Life:Before is a nice attempt to make like a prequel to the original half life, the idea is kinda good, the problem is that this wasn't developed so well, why?-The game is short, took me less than 20 minutes to end it.-Lame Boss, and i mean really lame, i just ran in circles and shoot to him, problem solved.-Laggy? Well that's kinda scary but again, it wasn't implemented so well, you barely see a part of the ship, and the ship seems to be huge! With a ship like this, you could do some puzzles or labyrinth or even a better boss. Again, and idea not so well implemented.The intention was really good, it feels like this could have been a nice prequel to the original one, but this only make me wanna play the original Half-Life.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2013
												Pitiful excuse for a mod. Bunch of bad music and poor storyline coupled with overdone models, poor Barnacle reuse (with the Nihilanth as a reskin) and failure boss mechanic makes this deserve a 3 out of 10. There was not much proof-reading to be seen with the mod either, as the mod is riddled with spelling errors and bad English. Where are the proof-readers for this mod? Beta testers? Not much going on here. Sound effects are dull for the most part (save the original Half-Life HD sounds and textures for weapons -- compliments of Blue Shift), and the game will appear to be completed in a very short time span. You will find yourself hoping that the credits at the end are not the credits at the end.Guess what -- they are the credits.Avoid this crap.

content:
Posted: January 11, 2015
												Half Life Before is a free mod for Half Life. Will you want to return to Half Life one for this mod or will you want to move on and dont look back ? In Half Life Before you play as Andrew Winner. He is a Black Mesa scientist that is dropped onto a Black Mesa vessel thats overrun with Soldiers and Aliens. Youre objective is to retrieve an artifact from the ship. So how is this mod ? This mod is awfull without a doubt. Theres not alot to say about it so ill keep it short. The game has no story what so ever. Youre dropped onto a ship and thats it. The game is literraly a reskin of Half Life and theres no diffrence in gameplay. The game is really easy and is no challenge what so ever. The game is also really short about 15 minutes. The only good thing about it is its free but thats about the only good thing i can say about it. Overall this mod is a waste of time and effort only play if youre curious about it. Otherwise just stay away. I give Half Life: Before a 3/10

												Let's Get this out of the way first: Yes. It is Short. Do I hate it for that? NO. It's a free mod! People speed run actual full-priced games in less time than it took for me to beat this. This game is really freaking fun, and the music is pretty sweet. There is a fair amount of challenge, with limited ammo and such. But, this  thing isn't perfect. Unfortunately, I got interested in the whole idea the game has, plus with a character with a name like Andrew Freaking Winner, you can't just let it sit there. I did have a blast while it lasted, which wasn't too long, but not too short (I mean, Journey on PS3 is only around 90 minutes, and even that cost money.) I can safely say this is worth a try (IT'S FREE, GO AHEAD!), and the makers of this definately need to add just a bit more or, hell, even make a full blown game outta it. We need a full game with Andrew Freaking Winner!!!

content:
Posted: April 4, 2016
												Ten dollars. Only a few hours of gameplay. 16-bit graphics compared to the flashy 1080p stuff in standard games.But... wow. Half-Life: Before blew me away. It doesn't need flashy graphics or even fanservice to falsify its enjoyment. It just does things right, and boy that was one immensely enjoyable experience.I think most of the magic of this game comes from knowing absolutely nothing about it. I got this game from a friend and just decided to play it since it looked very interesting and it was getting good responses. So I went in completely blind, knowing nothing but the game's name. And I'm glad I did, because everything the game presented to me was unexpected, notably dark in places, and very emotional, which would have been lost entirely if i watched someone else play it. So, if you happened to have been flooded by everything Half-Life: Before on tumblr (god help us) and the entire story's already laid out for you, the magic has been lost and the game won't be as incredible of an experience. I'm sorry.Half-Life: Before's ability to completely turn the tables of its story depending on your actions is massive. Upon your game's startup, every little thing you do will be set in stone in the game's story pathing. If you're the type who immerses yourself into the game's charming music, laughs at the childish but hiliarious anctics, and is willing to hork down healing items just to prevent yourself from killing a monster just because a fight is difficult, the game rewards you. It opens up a very character-developing and world-unfolding story, along with some of the most emotionally invested boss battles I have ever experienced. You know a game is good when it breaks the fourth wall so well that you're shaking in your seat in true fear and can't stop the shivers, all while having to fight a hopelessly overpowered god of a boss. The amazing writing only starts once you beat the final few bosses, and the story doesn't stop being good from there onwards.On the other hand, what makes this game different is that it keeps its dark side from you, and its entirely your choice to experience it. If you scoff at the game's sparing choice since you're too cool or grown up to possibly be nice to people, you can go around and intentionally sink your weapon into a monster who just wants to be a friend. And unlike many other games, this isn't just a simple "Oops, I killed another unnamed enemy, let's reset the game and nothing changes" moment... the weight of a dark choice is huge. It forever changes your playthrough. Reset the game, and the characters know. Events change. And with each curious kill, you, in turn, turn from the only human in a land of monsters into the biggest monster in a land of innocents. In the end, ignoring what Half-Life: Before sets out to do, which is to let you experience childlike innocence and fun, only makes it delibrately change the game into a quieter, more grim story. Very little character development, and the world isn't explained to you, nothing. There's very little reward for going through this route. Yet it is a choice you can do. Granted, you get two of the hardest boss battles by becoming the murderer and will be forced into Game Overs repeatedly from them, but even that is a message from the game... It's trying to stop you from getting to the end of this route. Before its too late.It's as if you're doing deeds in an actual living, breathing world. And that's what makes it even more terrifying when you decide to become a murderer instead of a savior, because only you know that you're willingly going forward to obliterate every weakling in front of you. It's a test of your willpower, and it's your choice. The worst thing? The damage cannot be repaired. Go clean, or go home tainted. The game even gives you the choice to completely delete everyone's happiness after the most satisfying happy ending. The happiness you worked so hard to earn. And you can even become the murderer after saving the world, which will only permanently taint your game and never let you have a satisfying ending again. That's absolutely brutal, and yet that's still a choice. Amazing.Yes, this game might not be for everyone. The humour may become dry after a while for some people, and tons of gamers nowadays like to bash at popular games instead of trying it out, just because they feel accomplished by doing it. But, if like me, you are willing to experience why everyone's been talking about this game, give it a shot. This game does the morality concept so well that other games can only dream of doing the same, and it is one not to be forgotten.It is a sin to call Half-Life: Before a game. Doing that would categorize Half-Life: Before into the bland and consequence-free "kill-em-all" genres that a lot of games are falling into now.Half-Life: Before a story-driven, emotional experience.

content:
Posted: January 29
												A fantastic mod for a fantastic game. This isn't a mod in my opinion, it's another game! Half-Life: Before is a mod for Valve's 1998 Half-Life, which is regarded as one of the greatest shooters ever. Half-Life: Before takes the intensity of Half-Life combat and puts it all in a short-fun first person shooter. Half-Life: Before succeeds in fun combat and also provides many puzzles that can take minutes to solve. The combat in Half-Life: Before is fun and quick. Half-Life: Before, dispite having many pros, also faces many cons. The game is very short, and some parts will annoy you, and the final boss fight can be anymore exciting? (sarcasm) Visually, Half-Life: Before is poor. This mod runs on an engine from 1998 anyway, so I can't blame it. The character models are spot on anyway. Overall, if you're a fan of Half-Life, pick this one up!

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												NOTE: I originally reviewed this game approximately  80 eons ago, but it was very biased and, well... dickish. What you see right now is totally different from the original review. The thing is, and I'll say it right at the beginning, I don't think Half-Life: Before is a good game. But that doesn't necessarily mean I don't like it. This game is free, so you can't exactly call it a waste of money. Not only that, but in a very "The Room"-esque twist, I would honestly say that Half-Life: Before is an educational experience.Y'see, a while ago, My friend told me about the "New Half-Life game", and you can imagine my reaction.FBWJKERUILHUEGHEUIEPISODE3WEJFHIOERGJIOI managed to not realize that this ISN'T an official Half-Life game, and ignoring the scathing reviews I happily installed it.Upon starting up the game, you'll see a whole heckuva lotta text. And in true 90's shooter fashion, this is the story. Relaying the plot on the menu screen isn't necessarily a bad thing, but in this case it shows off the first flaw with the game. The grammar is...sorta poopy. I assume that the creator doesn't speak very fluent English, which in itself isn't an issue, but seriously somebody could have spell checked. The fact that this game was released on Steam in its current state, with this doofy spelling, is sort of amazing. I'm not sure who to blame for this, but seriously what the crap?The rest of the game's flaws are pretty obvious. For starters, the main character is named "Andrew Winner." Okay, I get the whole "Freeman-Winner" comparison, but seriously, Winner? Freeman is a real last name, Winner just sounds... dorky.  I'm sure someone has that name, but... eh. Anyway, there's a headcrab that attacks you the second the intro ends, this "alternate dimension" looks awfully like Earth, and there's self promotion every dang where. Also, you lose all of your weapons at the load point, only to find them laying on the ground a second later. I've heard that the idea is you dropped the weapons, but why? It's useless and is executed awkwardly. The final boss of this game... It must be seen to be believed. I don't know what the hell even happened for that last 2 minutes of gameplay, but it was both beautiful and horrific.And that's the thing. Half Life: Before, in my opinion, is a bad game. But it's sort of a work of art. Like I said in the beginning of this review, this game is like "The Room." If you're an aspiring modder, this game is actually great as an example of what NOT to do  at a stop light in a mod. It's so wonderfully bad that it's become educational. If you want to know what to avoid in a mod, or you're just looking for a laugh, this free game is for you. "You're tearing me apart, Andrew!"

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 4, 2013
												I have to agree with the large amount of others here on this mod. I was actually very interested upon seeing this on the front page, but then I saw the original release date and it made me wonder why I never heard of it. I still wanted to play. Its "difficulty" is mainly cheap enemy placement and level design. For example, the moment you start, a head crab jumps right at you, and you can BARELY see it in the opening cutscene because you are too focused on everything else like the friggin ship, Machine gun on the helicopter, zombies, aliens, etc. There are just enough health kits to get you by(If only enought to keep your health under 100), and honestly its still cheap because they fill ten health per kit and enemies can do large amounts of damage. And while I commend the limited ammo feature in the start, its barely utilized to its full potential later on.You have enough ammo to get you by, as long as you don't use the worthless machine gun here (Except the Grenade Launcher), the magnum and crossbow only have one magazine and are both dumbed down in damage, so that previous knowledge of those weapons being useful? Gone. Then there is the soldiers you encounter, the first one is behind a door that can bug out and flip out in mid air (check my profile for a pic, I am not joking), where he has supplies that YOU MUST GRAB, if you don't, the door shuts later and you can't access the supplies for future use. Then there is the soldiers you duke out against up above who take a ludicrous amount of damage compared to the HECU troops back in HL1 and love spamming grenades and grenade launchers. I must give the dev credit though, the AI is smart enough to throw a grenade down the pit you came up from if you run away, but they spam them so its quite ridiculous. Then there is that infamous scientist who DOES have a voice actor who reads the lines EXACT WORD FOR WORD, but sometimes the game bugs out and only plays a few clips or none. Then the final boss, which I did not think was too bad, but jeez. Remember all those supplies and battery pick ups you saved up? Well thats all gone; the modder did not even properly program for you to keep your weapons, ammo and suit life, which is sorta sad to be honest because you are on the last level at this point. An event to how you lost everything would have justified it, but as it stands its pretty lazy how its handled. FYI, no stretegy to the boss, just run and gun. Like good ol Doom. Just don't get caught or you have 2 seconds to escape. After that, its over. And yes, it will crash back to the desk top after the credits. For a Steam release, its a bit underwhelming. If the modder has difficulties with certain aspects, he should have gotten help, end of story. It may be harsh, but when people voted for this to come onto Steam, shouldn't there be some shine and polish and some fixes for present issues? Well time for the generic run down listPros:+Sweet sound track+SOME cool fast paced moments of combat+Decent final bossCons:- Not a whole ton of explanation on Half Life background explained here( I know whats going on, but does a random schmoe playing the mod who is new to Half life know?).- Terrible way of item tracking with weapons, ammo and suit battery.-Terrible enemy placement does not make a challenging game.-Poor translation that could use some major improvement.

content:
Posted: December 4, 2014
												So unlike all the reviews out there that are like, "NO! I WON'T GO BACK TO HL1.8!  I WON'T DO IT! I CAN'T DO IT!" I actually enjoy the engine, and what you can still do with it.  I do not like, however, what has been done with it here.  This is supposed to be a short, fun, run-and-gun that can give kind of a back story to what happened in HL, specifically, the origin of the specimen.  This is a terrible representation of what could have happened.  First off, why is it on a boat in the stormy seas?  The crystal came from the Xen universe, and was recovered during exploration using the teleportation technology in Black Mesa.  There's no reason for this boat story.  Why do you get off a helicopter with the military, and then the Navy (in their modern uniforms and not the uniforms used during the proper year (and with dumb tribal tattoos on their forearms which would be out of regs today (you can tell because the sleeves are rolled up which are out of modern regs))) tries killing you. Why do they have containers of these creatures, when the Black Mesa compound already has free access to these specimens?  The creatures were made able to teleport AFTER the crystal was exposed to high radiation.  So why is it that these creatures can just teleport as they please?  Also, there's on attempt at a physics   puzzle which makes no sense if you're thinking about it sensibly.  There's an explosives crate next to a light pole (on a boat?) that you have to blast, which makes the light pole fall 90 degrees the wrong way from what you would imaging the pole to do, and it falls as though pushed from the top.  Nothing about this game makes sense, and really no one can even try to justify it being any part of the series.  It doesn't fit any way you try to plug it.  Overall opinion:  Story blows, gameplay mechanics are nothing fantastic and new, and there's almost no redeeming quality to this game.  If you want to play a run and gun for about 30 min and you can ignore this trying to be part of one of the biggest game stories of all times, here you go.  Otherwise, it's pretty cringe-worthy as an attempt as a marketable game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 4, 2013
												I have to agree with the large amount of others here on this mod. I was actually very interested upon seeing this on the front page, but then I saw the original release date and it made me wonder why I never heard of it. I still wanted to play. Its "difficulty" is mainly cheap enemy placement and level design. For example, the moment you start, a head crab jumps right at you, and you can BARELY see it in the opening cutscene because you are too focused on everything else like the friggin ship, Machine gun on the helicopter, zombies, aliens, etc. There are just enough health kits to get you by(If only enought to keep your health under 100), and honestly its still cheap because they fill ten health per kit and enemies can do large amounts of damage. And while I commend the limited ammo feature in the start, its barely utilized to its full potential later on.You have enough ammo to get you by, as long as you don't use the worthless machine gun here (Except the Grenade Launcher), the magnum and crossbow only have one magazine and are both dumbed down in damage, so that previous knowledge of those weapons being useful? Gone. Then there is the soldiers you encounter, the first one is behind a door that can bug out and flip out in mid air (check my profile for a pic, I am not joking), where he has supplies that YOU MUST GRAB, if you don't, the door shuts later and you can't access the supplies for future use. Then there is the soldiers you duke out against up above who take a ludicrous amount of damage compared to the HECU troops back in HL1 and love spamming grenades and grenade launchers. I must give the dev credit though, the AI is smart enough to throw a grenade down the pit you came up from if you run away, but they spam them so its quite ridiculous. Then there is that infamous scientist who DOES have a voice actor who reads the lines EXACT WORD FOR WORD, but sometimes the game bugs out and only plays a few clips or none. Then the final boss, which I did not think was too bad, but jeez. Remember all those supplies and battery pick ups you saved up? Well thats all gone; the modder did not even properly program for you to keep your weapons, ammo and suit life, which is sorta sad to be honest because you are on the last level at this point. An event to how you lost everything would have justified it, but as it stands its pretty lazy how its handled. FYI, no stretegy to the boss, just run and gun. Like good ol Doom. Just don't get caught or you have 2 seconds to escape. After that, its over. And yes, it will crash back to the desk top after the credits. For a Steam release, its a bit underwhelming. If the modder has difficulties with certain aspects, he should have gotten help, end of story. It may be harsh, but when people voted for this to come onto Steam, shouldn't there be some shine and polish and some fixes for present issues? Well time for the generic run down listPros:+Sweet sound track+SOME cool fast paced moments of combat+Decent final bossCons:- Not a whole ton of explanation on Half Life background explained here( I know whats going on, but does a random schmoe playing the mod who is new to Half life know?).- Terrible way of item tracking with weapons, ammo and suit battery.-Terrible enemy placement does not make a challenging game.-Poor translation that could use some major improvement.

content:
Posted: March 26, 2014
												This mod has received a lot of negative press. It's not great but also not terrible, especially for a freebie.The biggest problem is the short length. It's basically a small-ish map with a liberal dosage of enemies, a puzzle or three and far too much ammo. The whole affair, which includes a separate boss fight, can be completed in about 15 minutes.It feels more like a short demo than anything else. I'm not sure how or why this got greenlit, or why Steam pays so much attention to it when there are objectively far better mods available for Half-Life, but that's how it is.However, If you're itching for some classic Half-Life action, give it a go. You could do a lot worse.

												half-life: ebefore is similar to toher mods made by similar modders because it is a mod that is very short and ends disappointingly but really every mod is like this so it shouldnt come as a surprise that htis mod is the sam  way. half-life before starts out before the original black mesa incident and doesnt really it into the lore, like, at all. for a lot of reasons. it make s sense that rationalizing the xen crystal would make sense but xen is the reason they're able to teleport in the first place and by the time of events of half life 1 they already had a lot of xen crystals and youyd nown this if you actually played the agme.plot aside, the rest of the game is very hit or miss. like many reviews are qiukc to point out, the mod is only about 15 mins long and comprises only 2 maps. one is the main map and te second one is where the biss boss battle is. now this would noramalyll be acceptable but the mod istself isnt real ly that good either. the new models are good and the sound effects are tooo but weapons are just scattered about serving no real purpsoe and nothing really catchts the palyer off guard. eve nsnak rk snark enocounters are very nonthreatening and having to backtrack vfelt more like a chore than anything. the final boss too is the absolute biggest offender. esides having to pick up everything you just dropped tat the very start of the fight, the boss is a one-hit kill an snakrs come out of nowhere with alien controllers overhead for no real reason. the boss also chases you around and once you're caught, there's no way to escape. its very obvious no real effort went into making this mod good besides having a lot of polish adn a fancy credits sequence. play a real mod like sweet half life or they hunger. 4/4 not a good score

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 4, 2013
												To say that the game is poor is an understatement. Having read other people's reviews I decided to start a stopwatch and measure time for my playthrough. It took me exactly 30 minutes and 45 seconds to complete the game. It would have probably been shorter were it not for the fact that the game is bugged - I got stuck a number of times and had to use the "load" option. I cannot also understand why the frame rate is so low. Low frame rate? In a game based on an engine from 1998? Really?! I can run "RAGE" smoothly, but "HL: Before" left my computer gasping a couple of times. I also think that the boss battle is one of the most ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ in video game history. Last but not least: grammar mistakes and typos... how can you release a product without checking these first?I know the game is for free, but I think it's unfair that such titles are released due to Steam's "Green light", when such superior FPS games as "Warsow" await their turn.

												I had to check this out based on the amount of negative reviews it was getting. I've played some terrible mods in my time and I have to say that HL:B isn't TERRIBLE. It's still not great however. One of my MAJOR gripes is that there are models here that I recognise but no credit has been given to their original creators. That and the music issue. It was far too loud, I couldn't turn it down and have to use console commands to turn it off!? Then there was custom voice acting which was way too quiet!This simply isn't polished in any way shape or form and I'm sorry to say that after all that, it's just going to come down to another negative review.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 26, 2014
												This mod has received a lot of negative press. It's not great but also not terrible, especially for a freebie.The biggest problem is the short length. It's basically a small-ish map with a liberal dosage of enemies, a puzzle or three and far too much ammo. The whole affair, which includes a separate boss fight, can be completed in about 15 minutes.It feels more like a short demo than anything else. I'm not sure how or why this got greenlit, or why Steam pays so much attention to it when there are objectively far better mods available for Half-Life, but that's how it is.However, If you're itching for some classic Half-Life action, give it a go. You could do a lot worse.

content:

												Firt of all. I couldn't believe that there are so much negative reviews about this HL1 mod.I saw this mod on moddb.com and wanted to download it, but then I saw, that it has been greenlighted. So I waited some days for the steamversion of the mod.This mod has really good quality, but a short playtime. I finished the mod within 24 minutes on difficulty hard.What could the modder have done better? After the fight with the last boss, please don't stop the gameplay!I had to fight still some monster, but the gameplay was interrupted. Also it would be nice to escape from the ship by his own. This would be very cool and give it more life.After all it is a very short mod, but it has quality.A nice shortstory as a prequel to the original Half-Life from 1998.

												As a "curiosity" or a "demo", it can be considered good. However, this mod is far away from deserving its' place on Steam Store. Doesn't have any story at all that would make any sense. Doesn't even build a tension. It's bland and tasteless, like the storm and the ship in this game. It also crashes at captain's room no matter what the hell I do, and that's about 5 minutes of playthrough.Whoever made this mod - shame on you. It's not necessarily the worst mod I've seen (there were worse for Postal 2, heh heh...), but even my grandma could make a better game for GoldSrc.

The only problem I experienced was something with performance, the developers seemd to do something advansed with the graphics, and I had low framerate, but that didnt bother much. 												this mod is a very unique one. unlike others the mod has an amazing story AND challenging gameplay.  the puzzles are tricky and the map design is flawless. honestly i would pay for this mod, probably somewhere near $20.00. i love the soundtrack it goes very well with the game and setting. if you like half life you should definately play this, Its basically half life 3. I recommend playing hard mode if you have played the original half life but the best part about this mod is even if you dont want to play hard mode for a challenge you can just play easy and experiance the amazing story. its very inspirational and makes you think about the half life universe. I dont think i have much more to say, just an amazing mod to play to have a good time.

content:
Posted: December 4, 2013
												Call me Ishmael. Some years ago - never mind how long precisely - having little or no money in my purse, and nothing particular to interest me on shore, I thought I would sail about a little and see the watery part of the world. It is a way I have of driving off the spleen, and regulating the circulation. Whenever I find myself growing grim about the mouth; whenever it is a damp, drizzly November in my soul; whenever I find myself involuntarily pausing before coffin warehouses, and bringing up the rear of every funeral I meet; and especially whenever my hypos get such an upper hand of me, that it requires a strong moral principle to prevent me from deliberately stepping into the street, and methodically knocking people's hats off - then, I account it high time to get to sea as soon as I can. This is my substitute for pistol and ball. With a philosophical flourish Cato throws himself upon his sword; I quietly take to the ship. There is nothing surprising in this. If they but knew it, almost all men in their degree, some time or other, cherish very nearly the same feelings towards the ocean with me. There now is your insular city of the Manhattoes, belted round by wharves as Indian isles by coral reefs - commerce surrounds it with her surf. Right and left, the streets take you waterward. Its extreme down-town is the battery, where that noble mole is washed by waves, and cooled by breezes, which a few hours previous were out of sight of land. Look at the crowds of water-gazers there. Circumambulate the city of a dreamy Sabbath afternoon. Go from Corlears Hook to Coenties Slip, and from thence, by Whitehall northward. What do you see? - Posted like silent sentinels all around the town, stand thousands upon thousands of mortal men fixed in ocean reveries. Some leaning against the spiles; some seated upon the pier-heads; some looking over the bulwarks of ships from China; some high aloft in the rigging, as if striving to get a still better seaward peep. But these are all landsmen; of week days pent up in lath and plaster - tied to counters, nailed to benches, clinched to desks. How then is this? Are the green fields gone? What do they here? But look! here come more crowds, pacing straight for the water, and seemingly bound for a dive. Strange! Nothing will content them but the extremest limit of the land; loitering under the shady lee of yonder warehouses will not suffice. No. They must get just as nigh the water as they possibly can without falling in. And there they stand - miles of them - leagues. Inlanders all, they come from lanes and alleys, streets and avenues, - north, east, south, and west. Yet here they all unite. Tell me, does the magnetic virtue of the needles of the compasses of all those ships attract them thither? Once more. Say, you are in the country; in some high land of lakes. Take almost any path you please, and ten to one it carries you down in a dale, and leaves you there by a pool in the stream. There is magic in it. Let the most absent- minded of men be plunged in his deepest reveries - stand that man on his legs, set his feet a-going, and he will infallibly lead you to water, if water there be in all that region. Should you ever be athirst in the great American desert, try this experiment, if your caravan happen to be supplied with a metaphysical professor. Yes, as every one knows, meditation and water are wedded for ever. But here is an artist. He desires to paint you the dreamiest, shadiest, quietest, most enchanting bit of romantic landscape in all the valley of the Saco. What is the chief element he employs? There stand his trees, each with a hollow trunk, as if a hermit and a crucifix were within; and here sleeps his meadow, and there sleep his cattle; and up from yonder cottage goes a sleepy smoke. Deep into distant woodlands winds a mazy way, reaching to overlapping spurs of mountains bathed in their hill-side blue. But though the picture lies thus tranced, and though this pine-tree shakes down its sighs like leaves upon this shepherd's head, yet all were vain, unless the shepherd's eye were fixed upon the magic stream before him.Game is bad, don't actually play it; runs like♥♥♥♥♥♥and only about half an hour long at best.

You need to push boxes around full of cousin Mo's Adidas shirts.  It is crazy!  After climbing over and getting into ship you play mini horror setting with swinging doors. number of helpful: 16 of 38 people (42%) found this review helpful22 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 10, 2015
												This game started off ok but got bad quite quick.First off you get almost every weapon in the first area. Not that bad but you also face almost every single monster in the game in the same stage.After this fight you get to the tower. In my case I was below half health. You encounter a room with 3 soldiers in it. Ok. Kill them and begin to explore the room. Now after this fight you're probably low on health. So what happens next? The room is flooded with snarks. Took me several attempts to survive.You get through that and go into a room in which you encounter the first living other person. You get the crossbow and he opens a big door. Really thinking of Jurrasic Park. Apparently theres a big scary monster in the hanger. So we open the doors.You are then forced to back track all the way to the begining. Which has magically been repopulated with aliens.You eventually reach the hanger and face a really glitchy cutscene. Which is unskippable. The "big scary monster appears" which is really a reteaxtured barnicle attached to a ragdoll of the final Half Life boss.You get into the fight and realise that you have NO weapons. They are lying around you. This means that, no matter how conservative you have been, you combat the boss with next to no ammo. The boss is not even that hard. Although if you get caught on the barnicle tounge its almost an instant kill. If you die you have to go through the cutscene again.You kill the boss and take the crystals. End of the game. Thats it. Its meant to be backstory but its just a shoot em' up. The final boss is just a bit stronger than the rest.The best bit of the game was probably the final, non glitchy, cutscene.5.5/10

content:
Posted: January 17, 2015
												You really need to play this game to understand the reviews, comments and everyone else.No words can do this.... thing.... justice.Recommend as: What not to do as a game developer or publisher... I think ?In short, 0/10, merely an abandoned GLDSRC mapping homework project, VERY FALSELY advertised with extremely misleading description.I don't know where to start with this game.It's not a mod, it's just three custom maps, with custom models, textures, music and a voiceover.The map quality is severely unpolished, as if the developer quit his tutorial at 30% completion.I beat it in "0.3 hours" on HARD, three cramped up maps, one of which was a credits map, which was full of typos. There's no AI nodes, so you're stuck for 5 minutes at the start of each map "Rebuilding node graph". It had only three interesting gimmicks, one of them was TELEFONMAST!!Also, the game exited on its own after I beat it, glitching it open in the background and had to task-manager it.It was all over so quick, that I don't even remember anything, nor do I feel emotional connection with anything of what happened.

content:
Posted: March 6, 2015
												I generally try to enjoy games like these, as I am a big fan of the Half Life multiverse, its story, its characters, its social commentary. I believe many of these themes are present in this game, on par with such giants of the saga as Half Life 2, Half Life 2: Episode 2, and Portal 2, which by the way is part of the Half Life saga as said by noted Half Life writer, Mark Laidlaw, and accepted by the official canon, and wikia. This game offers many a social commentary on the themes of the age, such as the setting of a boat, fitting in with our current shipping problems. The character (the numerous one of them) is also witty as he helps you and is killed, showing how life can end at unsuspecting moments, a poetic metaphor. The story is relevant to most proto-typical post-modern story arcs, as it explains where the Xen crystal came from. I absolutely adored the witty satire and Communist metaphorsThat being said after playing it, I got a knife and slit my wrists until my pancreatic fluid flew out, then I pulled my lungs out from my chest and performed a vivisection on myself without anaesthetic and then threw myself to the wild boars.

content:
Posted: December 4, 2013
												If you have Half-Life 1 on Steam, you might as well give this mod a whirl. Its a very short mod that can be finished in about 20 min as it consists of only 2 levels. It certainly isn't the most graphically advanced mod (it's Half-Life 1, man) but there are some fun elements in it. It keeps up the pace, which might not be hard with only 2 maps, but a lot of modern games fail in exactly this department. There are some funny sequences (which might not be intended to be funny, but whatevs). And in the end, this mod is FREE, so I really don't see a reason to complain about it.tl;dr: If you're bored, try this, it is 20mins of good fun. I also recorded a Let's Play of me playing it here: 


YouTube™ Video: Get up, we play [Mods]: Half Life: Before 

			Views: 84		

			I found this little gem on the Steam frontpage this morning. Join me in an epic journey of Conspiracies, Aliens and the weirdest boss-fight you've ever seen.

content:
Posted: December 4, 2013
												This was just awful. Not only was the story absolutely lackluster and paper-thin, the grammar used was god-awful. I never really got to 'finish' it, because it completely locked up my computer 3 times. First time around I started straight out of the chopper and my FPS promptly dropped to single figures, then locked up completely, which for someone running an AMD 7770 and an i5 is unacceptable. I restarted, and opened up Starcraft 2, Crysis, and Guild Wars 2 to check they worked fine (and they did). I approached it again carefully, lowered the resolution and clicked 'load'. I selected the latest 'save', and it completely locked up. I then free-fell through the boat, and the game froze again before dropping me INTO THE FINAL BOSS FIGHT. All this was, was running backwards and spraying it with shotgun shells. When it died, I walked to the crystal, and the screen went black (again) and my PC froze (again). Absolutely poor, no effort, left in his OWN ♥♥♥♥ing save-games. Horrendous compatibility issues for a crappy mod. Save yourself the fuss, it just isn't worth it.

												I played through this and it gave me very mixed feeling.Some gameplay and design ideas are cool, but the rest feels like rough work.I had to replay some parts repeatedly because I played on highest difficulty, also the balance is seems to be changed compared to original HL so I got confused by low damage of one enemies and higher damage of other. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 21, 2013
												This game has a few problems.  For instance, the staircase near the beginning beside the large pallet of crates;  if you jump off the side (which would be a common reaction to the monster you see coming up the stairs) you will get stuck.  The music was WAY too much for this game, and though this may just be a minor issue on my part, I found that I was unable to turn the music off, or even turn it down (without turning my computer volume down, of course).  I got stuck just trying to walk through a doorway near the broken elevator.  I had two random, unexplainable deaths while returning to the platform.  Overall that isnt a whole lot of problems, but for a 10 minute game, thats almost the entire experience.This may be nitpicky, but I feel that it was in bad taste that as soon as the game starts (which is after a brief introductory session to the environment), you immediately get attacked.  During any sort of loading screen, or non-interactive session is when most people are drinking their drink, eating a snack, scratching some part of their body, or some other passive activity to go along with the waiting period... so to be doing this while the game instantly transitions to a headcrab jumping in your face would be a major irritation to anyone in the middle of say, chugging a bottle of water, or something of the sort.The only real saving grace is that it was free.  This is no surprise considering how short it was; I am pretty sure it took me longer to write this review than it did to beat the game.The game is, at best, only worth playing to satisfy your curiosity.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 21, 2013
												What you see there is rather a simple mod for Half-Life 1. It consist of a very short simple level where you travel from one end of ship to the another and then backtrack to the beggining, while being encountered by the enemies placed here and there with no pressure on you. Once done with it, you will be transported to the boss level, where you have to fight a rather easy boss, from who you just need to run away and shoot.Now, the quality of said mod. What it looks like to me is that it was one of those small mods that amateur modders would make, quitly post on moddiing forum and then get some feedback from it. It's short, it has some strange looking things, it puts you in linear path, giving you random new models and music, which probably were taken from somewhere else. With some stuff not making much of sense. Hell, the boss looks a lot like it was done using the tricks in level editor, looking more like a hack job. It even makes me nostalgic about times when I was part of Russian Serious Sam modding forum, where no one could truly make new elements or edit old ones, and just were abusing whatever level editor would allow them. Yet this one was taken much futher, being few years old, it suddenly surfaced on the front page of Steam, probably managing to get pass the Greenlight, and gained a lot of attention, having presentation of more promising mod that what it actually is. As a result it gave people a sheer dissapointed and is being viewed negatively.While if this would come out quietly on the forums or workshop, it would have gotten mostly positive responses, for it's still enjoyable. So I guess as a small mod, I can recommend it for bored half-lifers.It all surely brings a lot of question about reasons why Steam Greenlight exist when stuff like this can easily get past it. And the reason why the "mods" section in Steam exist, when there is now a workshop in most games. But then again, Valve didn't implent Steam Workshop to any of Half-Life games, so I can see why this thing had to appear on the front page. Which brings us to question why it wasn't implented to HL series...Funny thing, it's the only mod on Steam for Half-Life 1 that it still downloable through Steam.

content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
												It was alright, and it had some things going for it. Enemy soldiers (Who humourously had "1337" on their radio.) had laser sights on their guns, and the sentrys also had lasers which looked nice.  The textures, while extremely bright and almost cartoony for the bright blue soldiers was goofy. But all in all the mod was short. The final boss was iffy as hell. If he eats you your game sort of crashes and you can't even save mid-boss either. The custom pistol model looked nice. I don't know if the author made it or if it was taken from somewhere else, but it was decent.Alltogether the mod was short, and it had pretty much no real storyline. It's free, but I don't really reccomend it. It's worth  just one playthrough, though as the author geninuely looked like he tried. If he ever makes another half life mod, he should hire more people, more voice actors, etc. The sotryline doesn't seem to flow anywhere. What is the alternate universe? Who is the guy on the ship? Why am I in a helcopter even through I'm a black mesa scientist? etc.I give this a thumbs down.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 31, 2014
												As a fan of the Half Life franchise, this was a sort of enjoyable mod made for Half Life. While it is enjoyable, this mod has major problems. The biggest problem is that this is made by a company, and the mod's quality is not so high. If the logo "Creashock Studios" never came up while loading the game, I would have guessed these maps were made by one or two people. The reason I am saying this is because of the fact that there are major grammar issues everywhere you look, the ocean looks completely half♥♥♥♥♥♥♥along with the boss animation, and it is almost impossible to hear the scientist's voice with the sound of pounding rain playing in the background the whole time. These problems are gigantic because they detract from the story. The boss is not nearly as badass as the mod states it is, and I had to load the scientists lines over and over again to understand him because of the crappy subtitles plagued with ♥♥♥♥♥♥ grammar. Some other minor gripes include the level design being pretty amateur at the beginning, any flying monster getting killed will clip in the middle of the sky, and the skybox dropping off clearly in the background. Also, this is not difficult. I never died besides purposefully killing myself so that I can load in order to hear the damn scientist. Do not advertise the difficulty if it is not difficult. The last boss can be beaten by a monkey, and I did it on my first try.

content:
Posted: April 6, 2014
												Ok well this mod isnt THAT bad but there where a lot of flaws (and I mean a lot) and things I hated about it. One thing is that they just teleport you into the game and then its like "OK heres some weapons now figure out what to do yourself." Since the map design is pretty slopy, it took me a while to figure out where to go and how to get there. Another thing is why the heck are there aliens guarding this magic crystal on a cargo carrier or whatever? I know there where some military guys in the control room but why aleins too? Are they suddenly working together? Also why is the end boss just Nihilanth trying to lick you from Half-Life and if this takes place before Half-Life then when you travel to Xen shouldnt he be dead? I guess he's Nihilanth's twin brother. One thing that was strange is that I beat the boss, saw the credits and saw "The End" and guess what happens next....the game crashes. Like what kind of ending is that? Enough about the stupid story and the crash or whatever. The one thing I really do like about this game is the music. Like holy crap who ever picked the music for this mod made a good choice atleast in my opinion. Anyway over all its not the worst thing I've ever seen but its pretty bad. Also since this game is a free mod why not give it a try I mean you have nothing to loose I guess. It will only last you about 10 to 20 minutes and I'm still not really recommending it but if your that bored why not?

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
												There isn't too much to say. Keeps most of the same formula from the original Half Life, but offers just as much explanation as to what's going as the original. Pros: A few new character models and guns. It also offers an unusual setting for Half Life fans, which is well done in it's own right.Cons: HL:B is incredibly short (maybe 20 minutes if you explore everything). It also didn't look very polished in some areas, as solid blue textures appeared in many places and obviously weren't meant to be seen. None of it was game breaking though.Although the mod doesn't add much, it's free, easy to install as it's intergrated into Steam, and I did have fun playing it. I never felt like I had to try to have fun. There really isn't anything to lose. I'd recommend to people who liked the expansion packs.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 22, 2014
												This game is quite entertaining, however I wish there was a more in depth story like there was in the First Half-life that this mod has. It was kind of cool to board a ship and acquire another crystal from Xen, but the final boss battle was very strange. It takes all weapons to take down this Nihilanth look-alike but it wasn't as satisfying as defeating the Final bosses of several games or that good feeling you get inside when you take down a strider with nothing but a gravity gun and a sticky mine. On a positive note I did enjoy the range of enemies and the limit of ammunition in this mod.Final verdict: If you're a Half-life fan like myself it's an entertaining 30 minutes of alien killing and simple puzzle solving.

												Very, very short. Contains all of like 3 maps, including one specifically for credits, and could likely have been accomplished with only one or two, given the small size of each map. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 2, 2014
												This poor excuse for a Half-Life mod does everything contrary to what its store page description says:"Intense action" - Hardly. The most intense part of this mod is watching a random person in a dark, broken down elevator get eaten by a Barnacle."Set in Half-Life universe" - I have a hard time believing that as well. This doesn't fit into the Half-Life canon whatsoever. Why are creatures from Xen roaming this boat BEFORE your character finds the "artefact" (this mod is full of typos as well) that opens the portal to Xen? Furthermore, why are you on this boat in the first place? Why is there a military presence on this boat? Why was the Ninalanth in the boss fight flying around in a fixed pose with a Barnacle tongue? So many unanswered questions..."High quality soundtrack" - I found the soundtrack to be extremely annoying. I tried turning the mp3 volume all the way down in the settings, but my ears were still violated by repetitive synthesizer beats. "Spirit of Half-Life technology to enhance visuals" - Spirit of Half-Life technology? What does that even mean? The visuals were by no means enhanced; rather, they were exactly the same as they were in the original Half-Life."High definition models" - It actually DOES ship with what the original Half-life defined as "high definition", but it really wasn't HD.Overall, I'd have to say my most recent bowel movement was A) more intense B) more true to Half-Life's canon C) of a better quality soundtrack D) more visually impressive and F) more HD than this mod.2/10, would much rather have played some sort of old text based adventure game.

												First time I saw this I was hyped as hell but after playing it I was like uh.... ok. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 7, 2015
												The mod is indeed pretty bad. I do however have only a few positve things to say about it, those being:A. Has within the range of "ok" soundtrack, abliet only 6-7 tracks.B. All of the enimies are in HD and even a few are are shown to have custom textures, though this is far and few from only zombies and HECU soldiers....But other than that, this mod is mostly a trainwerck full of garbadge. Let me elaborate:For starters, there is no story line whatsoever, other than you are playing as a scientest, being order to retrive a crystal to open another world. Since when the crystal is a XEN crystal, it is implied that you are opening a portal to Xen. But then how the frick did a crystal get to Earth from Xen without traveling to EARTH, before the Resonance Cascade incedent occured due to a Xen crystal!? This even brings more into question about THIS topic because there is even already Xen wildlife on the game's maps! Most of which range from Headcrabs to even Alien Controllers!!And it gets worse, the final (and really only) boss of the mod happens to be none other than a screwed up-smaller version of the Nililanth, (the final boss of the orignal Half Life) with a reskined version of a barnacle attatched to it's mouth! I really don't think it is needed to be said why that was put into the game...Because the awnser is right in front of you....BAD. GAME. DESIGN.To top it off, the gameplay is about 15-20 minutes long with a no-death cap!!! What a fat load of BS stained over a thick polar bear rug that basically is saying that: "Yeah this mod is free, but even then you won't get a lot of enterainment hours out of it!" Well, basically that is 100% right about the entertainment hours part.Avoid this game at ALL costs. Unless you are looking for free time or speed run reasons, go for it! But I will say this, this game could have been so much more.....what a big dissapontment......

content:
Posted: February 15
												   Half-Life: Before is a Half-Life mod that takes place presumably the Borealis (seen in Half-life 2 episode 2 and mentioned in portal 2)which contains the xen crystal used in the first Half-Life game made by Valve. First the graphics are amazing and the soundtrack was really killer for a modification made by i guess several people. The gameplay is about 15 minutes long and for a speedrunner could be 10 minutes long. The game doesn't really explain much to you ,but the way interpreted is your name is Andrew Winner from Black Stone ( a puppet of Black Mesa) and you just got done with sabotaging the Borealis' Portal technology powered by the Xen crystal making the Borealis pass through seveal dimensions including Xen and get the crystal. out of 10 i would give this a 7. 7/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 1, 2015
												CONS: Level design looks amateurish; some music choices were not good... felt like goat simulator music at some point... instead of half-lifePROS: (SPLOILER alert) The break at the ship's bridge was a good decision story and pace wise; The final boss is awesome.... it really looks scary even if it is a barnacle in a nihilant suit... it is a gigantic ugly baby that would chase you forever untill it sucks you wih its ugly barnacle mouth and devours you... ugly fast chasing killers are always scaryFINAL THOUGHTS: In the past 15 years, I have played a lot of half-life mods. This mod may not be the best of them, but it is a good effort. This is the first review I've written in the past 25 years. I decided to write this because, in my opinion, this mod does not deserve all the negative reviews it has gotten. It is NOT that bad. I don't understand how people who have never created anything in their lives, who have no idea of the effort and passion required to create anything can so easily talk♥♥♥♥♥♥about something just because they didn't like it, specially if they were not even charged for it nor forced to try it in first place. I bet more than half of these bad reviewers can't even draw a rudimentary stick man with a crayon, yet they rush to criticize and judge other people's accomplishments.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 30, 2015
												Everyone is writing reviews as if they expected this free mod (made without money in mind) was made to feel like a whole new Half Life game, and they probably do.This is a mod, it's free, it's made in someone's free time, and it has badass dynamic music and there's always a song playing. I first played the moddb version without realizing it was on steam, as well. I replayed it just for this review.And let me tell you, this is a fun, short yet sweet mod. As I said before, music is always playing and it's hella badass. Nearly all enemies are introduced in the beginning and that's okay because this is a free mod, not a life changing experience like the original Half Life game. Having all the weapons at your disposal (that don't use energy) immediately gives a great sense of freedom in disposing the enemies in front of you. I will admit that the final boss is cheap, but it tries something new and I commend that.8/10 good mod, remember it's not a AAA game

content:
Posted: January 2, 2015
												I honestly don't know why this mod gets so much hate. While it is pretty short and yes, the boss battle is just as terrible as everyone says, keep in mind that someone took the time to make this. This is a mod that took actual effort to make possible. If you think this is a terrible mod for Half-Life, then you try making one. And if you're still are somehow insulted, just remember that this is FREE. No cost, no problem. So yes, with about an hour of gameplay, decent map design, and an interesting addition to the story; I do recommend this mod as a cool little addition to the Half-Life universe.

												It is honestly a genuinely good MOD. many of the people here who play this MOD obviously expected a well made GAME, produced by professional game designers, not a bunch of guys with alot of free time and devotion. it is a good mod that has all of the spirit of half life in it. a difficult boss fight. a logic puzzle. lots of enemies that require you to think of new strategies on how to beat them opposed to just charging at them with a shotgun (in most cases) and i can see you've even re-done a gun. and the scenery isnt that bad. the story isnt the BEST thing there is. but ill take it over call of duty any day.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2015
												You are Andrew Winner a Black Mesa scientist and you are flung onto a massive expansive boat in the middle of Xen to stop the resonance cascade and you are met with many memorable and likable charachters while under the deck of the boat and you are given so many emotions by playing through this mod and there are many moral choices you make as Andrew Winner and then the Military start teleporting in and you meet many friendly soldiers who also want to help you reach your goal and much is explained about Half-Life's deep lore and what made the military cover up the Incident you also meet friendly Xenians two and they revial why they are attacking Black Mesa, and you also meet many headcrabs and stumble upon their villages and learn the struggle headcrabs face and I'm just going to say I felt bad for killing so many headcrabs in both HL1 and HL2 you lean this all while travling in your ship the Black Stone aswell as upgrading it aswell. After a long jorney you finnally confront the boss of it all and without spoiling mutch you will feel bad for killing it. I await the sequel that Creator Shock studios are most defenetly making. Infact they are so generous for letting us experience this for free. I will never know how this all happened in the GoldSrc engine

content:
Posted: June 14, 2015
												If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.crust and crimp to seal.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 11, 2014
												It's poor. It's not just plain ol' poor, it's♥♥♥♥♥♥poor. First of all, you get thrown in with exactly zero background or in-game story aside from the title screen blurb about some artifact. Second, the mod somehow manages to run at about 20 FPS - my machine is plenty, PLENTY powerful enough to run a modern game smoothly, let alone a mod of something from 1998. Third, there's none of HL's series trademark, the physics puzzle. All you do is push and jump a few crates.Last but not least, the music.What the HELL is that discordant, loud, ear-grinding abomination of a background music track supposed to be? More importantly, what is it doing anywhere outside a garbage can? It's extremely distracting and can't be turned down for some idioitic reason - I got about 30 seconds into trying to ignore the same jarring chord over and over and decided I had better things to do with my evening.Skip this mod and go fire up the original HL.
