number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 21, 2013
												This game has a few problems.  For instance, the staircase near the beginning beside the large pallet of crates;  if you jump off the side (which would be a common reaction to the monster you see coming up the stairs) you will get stuck.  The music was WAY too much for this game, and though this may just be a minor issue on my part, I found that I was unable to turn the music off, or even turn it down (without turning my computer volume down, of course).  I got stuck just trying to walk through a doorway near the broken elevator.  I had two random, unexplainable deaths while returning to the platform.  Overall that isnt a whole lot of problems, but for a 10 minute game, thats almost the entire experience.This may be nitpicky, but I feel that it was in bad taste that as soon as the game starts (which is after a brief introductory session to the environment), you immediately get attacked.  During any sort of loading screen, or non-interactive session is when most people are drinking their drink, eating a snack, scratching some part of their body, or some other passive activity to go along with the waiting period... so to be doing this while the game instantly transitions to a headcrab jumping in your face would be a major irritation to anyone in the middle of say, chugging a bottle of water, or something of the sort.The only real saving grace is that it was free.  This is no surprise considering how short it was; I am pretty sure it took me longer to write this review than it did to beat the game.The game is, at best, only worth playing to satisfy your curiosity.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
												It was alright, and it had some things going for it. Enemy soldiers (Who humourously had "1337" on their radio.) had laser sights on their guns, and the sentrys also had lasers which looked nice.  The textures, while extremely bright and almost cartoony for the bright blue soldiers was goofy. But all in all the mod was short. The final boss was iffy as hell. If he eats you your game sort of crashes and you can't even save mid-boss either. The custom pistol model looked nice. I don't know if the author made it or if it was taken from somewhere else, but it was decent.Alltogether the mod was short, and it had pretty much no real storyline. It's free, but I don't really reccomend it. It's worth  just one playthrough, though as the author geninuely looked like he tried. If he ever makes another half life mod, he should hire more people, more voice actors, etc. The sotryline doesn't seem to flow anywhere. What is the alternate universe? Who is the guy on the ship? Why am I in a helcopter even through I'm a black mesa scientist? etc.I give this a thumbs down.

												You start the game. You shoot aliens for 5 minutes. Then you waste a minute or two on physics puzzles that only exist to pad out the gameplay. Then you go in a door. I could've completed it twice writing this review.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 3, 2014
												Not a horrible mod. But extremely short -- 20 minutes long, really.I think I only liked it because it had been years since I played Half-Life. The stroll down memory lane was really awesome. Half-Life was a top-of-the-line game back in its day, and it was awesome getting a good reason to fire it back up again. :)Half-Life was always awesome because of its extreme flexibility. You could make any mod you wanted out of it -- from Day of Defeat, to The Specialist, to Natural Selection, to Counter Strike, to Earth's Special Forces, and the list goes on. Really good stuff. As such, since this is a Half-Life mod, I do have to recommend it. Because it's Half-Life. And it's a mod.:D

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 7, 2014
												When I started playing, I had high expectations, really high expectations from a game bearing the name Half-life. Did the game deliver, hell yes. This game is phenomenally well crafted, It looks fantastic (For a game made in '98, but that is when the classic came out so it is a good thing), It sounds fantastic (Again, for '98 and again a good thing). The gameplay is perfect, using the same things that made Half-life great and getting the amount of each thing just right.I only have 2 problems with this game, the first being cutscenes, it has them. When I saw the cutscenes, even though they were only about a second long, it didn't feel Half-lifeish, meaning I wasn't seeing what was happening as I should in a Half-life game. The second problem with this game was fairly minor, as soon as you walk through the door to the ships control tower, there is a small rat,  just a rat, but a rat that keeps repeating a dying animation.If you can, play this, it's a fun, well crafted game, despite having some things I didn't like, they were minor and barely bothered me when playing the game. Game devs, well done.

content:
Posted: April 6, 2014
												Ok well this mod isnt THAT bad but there where a lot of flaws (and I mean a lot) and things I hated about it. One thing is that they just teleport you into the game and then its like "OK heres some weapons now figure out what to do yourself." Since the map design is pretty slopy, it took me a while to figure out where to go and how to get there. Another thing is why the heck are there aliens guarding this magic crystal on a cargo carrier or whatever? I know there where some military guys in the control room but why aleins too? Are they suddenly working together? Also why is the end boss just Nihilanth trying to lick you from Half-Life and if this takes place before Half-Life then when you travel to Xen shouldnt he be dead? I guess he's Nihilanth's twin brother. One thing that was strange is that I beat the boss, saw the credits and saw "The End" and guess what happens next....the game crashes. Like what kind of ending is that? Enough about the stupid story and the crash or whatever. The one thing I really do like about this game is the music. Like holy crap who ever picked the music for this mod made a good choice atleast in my opinion. Anyway over all its not the worst thing I've ever seen but its pretty bad. Also since this game is a free mod why not give it a try I mean you have nothing to loose I guess. It will only last you about 10 to 20 minutes and I'm still not really recommending it but if your that bored why not?

content:
Posted: April 16, 2014
												I played through this and it gave me very mixed feeling.Some gameplay and design ideas are cool, but the rest feels like rough work.I had to replay some parts repeatedly because I played on highest difficulty, also the balance is seems to be changed compared to original HL so I got confused by low damage of one enemies and higher damage of other. But why don't reduce marines' health? You meet few of them in a tiny room and it ruins the gameplay, forcing you to camp behind cover and use AI flaws.As a plus, It feels like some explosives weapons are situated on the map as neatly as you should use them (satchel to take out marines and tripmine for snarks). It's like in a tactical shooter. That's something I'd like to see in other mods!The final boss was very annoying and that was the worst boss fight experience ever. It's too fast all you do is grab the weapons, run in cirkles and shoot at that thing. It's worse than DOOM is.There's plenty of stuff that could've been done so much better. I see big potential in this mod, accurate work on small props, but there are other problems like wrong chosen materials for som enteties or bad gameplay design.

content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
												There isn't too much to say. Keeps most of the same formula from the original Half Life, but offers just as much explanation as to what's going as the original. Pros: A few new character models and guns. It also offers an unusual setting for Half Life fans, which is well done in it's own right.Cons: HL:B is incredibly short (maybe 20 minutes if you explore everything). It also didn't look very polished in some areas, as solid blue textures appeared in many places and obviously weren't meant to be seen. None of it was game breaking though.Although the mod doesn't add much, it's free, easy to install as it's intergrated into Steam, and I did have fun playing it. I never felt like I had to try to have fun. There really isn't anything to lose. I'd recommend to people who liked the expansion packs.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 5, 2013
												This contains a whopping 20 minutes of gameplay that progresses in quite a shoddy fashion. The guns are acquired at a rate of basically one every twenty seconds, enemies seemingly pop out from behind every corner, and the mod forces you to use the HD pack graphics and will not allow the default Half Life models. There is basically no story to this mod, just go kill a bunch of Xen creatures and a few Marines mixed in for no reason at all. There is constant misspelling when it comes to the credits, and subtitles, and the dialogue (what little there is) is poorly written. The game culminates in a boss battle with what can only be summed up as the Nihilanth with a Barnacle attatched to its mouth. The boss fight is simple and involves running in circles and shooting upwards. This mod at no time ever makes the user think, you never feel as if you're in any real danger, and it entirely misses the essence and feel of the original Half Life. [4/10]

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 5, 2013
												It can literally be finished within 10 to 20 minutes. I thought the other reviewers were being hyperbolic, but it's the truth. It is, in essence, a simple fan map that was made to establish the origins of the sample used in Gordon Freeman's test chamber... which appears to be some random cargo ship that's filled with Xen creatures. It has some simple box puzzles, and some enemies to shoot. Really. That's all I can say without giving away the rest.Okay, twist my arm: a guy who speaks with poor spelling and grammar points at a poster of the final, scratch that, ONLY boss and says "Watch out for this guy!" AND THEN YOU FIGHT HIM.Worth a look? Maybe if you're studying level design and want an example of good intentions with sub-adequate execution. Or maybe to pick apart in Hammer to see how to create a bullet-sponge creature with a barnacle as its means of attack. But considering the size of both Half-Life and this mod, and remembering that it's 2013 (or later) and broadband Internet is basically the norm, it's a good way to kill a half hour or so on this trip down memory lane. That is, if you get nostalgic about the amount of custom maps for HL1 that used to come out, good, bad or otherwise.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 7, 2014
												When I started playing, I had high expectations, really high expectations from a game bearing the name Half-life. Did the game deliver, hell yes. This game is phenomenally well crafted, It looks fantastic (For a game made in '98, but that is when the classic came out so it is a good thing), It sounds fantastic (Again, for '98 and again a good thing). The gameplay is perfect, using the same things that made Half-life great and getting the amount of each thing just right.I only have 2 problems with this game, the first being cutscenes, it has them. When I saw the cutscenes, even though they were only about a second long, it didn't feel Half-lifeish, meaning I wasn't seeing what was happening as I should in a Half-life game. The second problem with this game was fairly minor, as soon as you walk through the door to the ships control tower, there is a small rat,  just a rat, but a rat that keeps repeating a dying animation.If you can, play this, it's a fun, well crafted game, despite having some things I didn't like, they were minor and barely bothered me when playing the game. Game devs, well done.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 31, 2014
												As a fan of the Half Life franchise, this was a sort of enjoyable mod made for Half Life. While it is enjoyable, this mod has major problems. The biggest problem is that this is made by a company, and the mod's quality is not so high. If the logo "Creashock Studios" never came up while loading the game, I would have guessed these maps were made by one or two people. The reason I am saying this is because of the fact that there are major grammar issues everywhere you look, the ocean looks completely half♥♥♥♥♥♥♥along with the boss animation, and it is almost impossible to hear the scientist's voice with the sound of pounding rain playing in the background the whole time. These problems are gigantic because they detract from the story. The boss is not nearly as badass as the mod states it is, and I had to load the scientists lines over and over again to understand him because of the crappy subtitles plagued with ♥♥♥♥♥♥ grammar. Some other minor gripes include the level design being pretty amateur at the beginning, any flying monster getting killed will clip in the middle of the sky, and the skybox dropping off clearly in the background. Also, this is not difficult. I never died besides purposefully killing myself so that I can load in order to hear the damn scientist. Do not advertise the difficulty if it is not difficult. The last boss can be beaten by a monkey, and I did it on my first try.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 5, 2014
												I wanted to try this mod out because is it quite literally the only Half-Life mod available for download and play through Steam, and also because I was hoping it would be a new Half-Life game experience I would enjoy.  Unortunately, I was thoroughly disappointed.  For starters, this mod has no real storyline, no intro, no prelude beyond "You are Black Mesa scientiest Andrew Winner, sent to retrieve an Artifact from Xen."  another that bothered me about it was that it dropped you straight into gameplay, and never gave you any indication of what you must do next to progress, meaning you are pretty much in the dark.  Finally, there is the fact the Intereact key binding is actually the Alternate Fire key binding, which is quite obviously a frustrating curve to get used to.  All in all, this mod just was not engaging or enjoyable for me.  Also, it froze my computer upon clicking "Quit."

												Major Problems:-The "story" did not exist. If there was a "story" it could not exist in the Half-Life universe if this happened "Before" the Black Mesa Incident, otherwise there would be no aliens, and the Marines would not be trying to kill you; if the map took place in Xen, why would Marines be there and why would Black Mesa send you into a hostile environment without a weapon?-The game obviously did not go through a quality control filter considering that the pacing was bad, the English was terrible, and the game crashes constantly.Good things:-The music was ok (for the first two minutes it was played)-The new pistol model is good

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 5, 2013
												This contains a whopping 20 minutes of gameplay that progresses in quite a shoddy fashion. The guns are acquired at a rate of basically one every twenty seconds, enemies seemingly pop out from behind every corner, and the mod forces you to use the HD pack graphics and will not allow the default Half Life models. There is basically no story to this mod, just go kill a bunch of Xen creatures and a few Marines mixed in for no reason at all. There is constant misspelling when it comes to the credits, and subtitles, and the dialogue (what little there is) is poorly written. The game culminates in a boss battle with what can only be summed up as the Nihilanth with a Barnacle attatched to its mouth. The boss fight is simple and involves running in circles and shooting upwards. This mod at no time ever makes the user think, you never feel as if you're in any real danger, and it entirely misses the essence and feel of the original Half Life. [4/10]

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
												Upon installing the mod, it was a very small file, and took only half a minute to download even when my internet connection was derping about. This mod is short and sweet. combining improved textures, a kick♥♥♥♥♥soundtrack that kept me at the edge of my seat, and some pretty well thought out map design. However it has some flaws. One it was a bit too short, it kept me wanting more than what it had offered. Two I feel the final boss was a bit copy and paste with some slapped on mechanics. Lastely It just seemed a bit too underdone, and left many things unexplained, such as "how did i get here?" "why are then xen aliens here?" "how is this in the half-life story?" and it just left me with those questions. However this game was enjoyable, and its free so there isn't really much to complain about. Sure it's not that replayable, but it was an experience that I enjoyed. I recomend this to any half-life fans and modders.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 4, 2013
												If you have Half-Life 1 on Steam, you might as well give this mod a whirl. Its a very short mod that can be finished in about 20 min as it consists of only 2 levels. It certainly isn't the most graphically advanced mod (it's Half-Life 1, man) but there are some fun elements in it. It keeps up the pace, which might not be hard with only 2 maps, but a lot of modern games fail in exactly this department. There are some funny sequences (which might not be intended to be funny, but whatevs). And in the end, this mod is FREE, so I really don't see a reason to complain about it.tl;dr: If you're bored, try this, it is 20mins of good fun. I also recorded a Let's Play of me playing it here: 


YouTube™ Video: Get up, we play [Mods]: Half Life: Before 

			Views: 84		

			I found this little gem on the Steam frontpage this morning. Join me in an epic journey of Conspiracies, Aliens and the weirdest boss-fight you've ever seen.

Posted: March 27, 2015
												You start the game. You shoot aliens for 5 minutes. Then you waste a minute or two on physics puzzles that only exist to pad out the gameplay. Then you go in a door. Then you shoot a couple more aliens. You climb an elevator. You kill three soldiers. Then you backtrack, making sure you kill all the monsters as you go (because if you miss even one, you'll die falling down the pit instead of fighting the final boss for some reason). Then you fight a barnacle attached to the HL1 boss with no animations. By 'fight' I mean look up, run backwards in circles and mash left click. Then end.Good thing this is free. I could've completed it twice writing this review.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 20, 2015
												When l downloaded the mod, l expected it to be a simple, fun and alternate version of Half-Life. Boy, was l wrong. How did this blob of crap (no offense) get from Greenlight to a full game?! I agree with the ratings on this mod.Don't judge me yet, l love Half-Life. But the games are supposed to be challenging, full of puzzles and the plotline is and always will be different and creative, if not sometimes mysterious. This modification sadly was not good enough.Although the NPCs were good at attacking me here and there, once I got near the bridge of the ship, I got a little bored. Killing aliens and enemy soldiers can be fun, only if they aren't placed in most expected places. Now, you can tell me that the same thing happens in other games like Half-LIfe 2, but those games didn't give away expectations about what will happen at the next moment, when this game unfortunately, did, in many different ways.Another problem is that these modifications for the franchise should be, in my opinion, longer than at least than fifteen minutes. Any chapter of Half-Life, its sequels, its spinoffs, or mods can take up mostly 25-40 minutes of your time. I ran from one end of the cargo ship to the other and back in almost eight minutes (not speedrunning!).Fortunately, for you, game-creator, there was one one thing l thought was interesting -  THE BOSS. I thought when jumping into the final level, "okay, grab the artifact, end the game, play CS:GO next". But then when the giant beast broke through the vent, 'stole' the crystal, and wanted to eat me, trying to kill it was a hard challenge, mind you. I died four times before finishing the game. (The whole time l was playing in HARD mode)Well, that about wraps up the negative nitpicks for this game. Don't call me harsh, or call me a bully, or even a dumb f**k who doesn't know what gaming is all about. Because those insults are not true. All l'm saying is this game..no, sorry-MOD, could have been a little better.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 20, 2015
												When l downloaded the mod, l expected it to be a simple, fun and alternate version of Half-Life. Boy, was l wrong. How did this blob of crap (no offense) get from Greenlight to a full game?! I agree with the ratings on this mod.Don't judge me yet, l love Half-Life. But the games are supposed to be challenging, full of puzzles and the plotline is and always will be different and creative, if not sometimes mysterious. This modification sadly was not good enough.Although the NPCs were good at attacking me here and there, once I got near the bridge of the ship, I got a little bored. Killing aliens and enemy soldiers can be fun, only if they aren't placed in most expected places. Now, you can tell me that the same thing happens in other games like Half-LIfe 2, but those games didn't give away expectations about what will happen at the next moment, when this game unfortunately, did, in many different ways.Another problem is that these modifications for the franchise should be, in my opinion, longer than at least than fifteen minutes. Any chapter of Half-Life, its sequels, its spinoffs, or mods can take up mostly 25-40 minutes of your time. I ran from one end of the cargo ship to the other and back in almost eight minutes (not speedrunning!).Fortunately, for you, game-creator, there was one one thing l thought was interesting -  THE BOSS. I thought when jumping into the final level, "okay, grab the artifact, end the game, play CS:GO next". But then when the giant beast broke through the vent, 'stole' the crystal, and wanted to eat me, trying to kill it was a hard challenge, mind you. I died four times before finishing the game. (The whole time l was playing in HARD mode)Well, that about wraps up the negative nitpicks for this game. Don't call me harsh, or call me a bully, or even a dumb f**k who doesn't know what gaming is all about. Because those insults are not true. All l'm saying is this game..no, sorry-MOD, could have been a little better.

Posted: January 24, 2016
												I went into this mod after reading some comments and I thought I would hate it, but it actually turned out to be pretty fun. The levels have lots of detail and are quite pretty for goldsrc, and the level design rewards thinking outside of the box. The final boss was also better than I expected, which is a plus. My only complaint is that theres no real indication of how you should progress through the level, and it can sometimes be difficult to find out what you have to do to move forward. If your a fan of half life, and you just want to play some more of it, this should keep you happy for about half an hour.

content:
Posted: March 13, 2016
												This mod definitely isn't one of the best ones out there. The development is very choppy, gameplay is about 15 minutes, and nothing is really explained. The text on objects seems unprofessional (for example, too many exclamation marks, inconsistency with "artifact" and "artefact", etc.). It seems like development was very rushed.It felt like a singleplayer version of early Counter Strike custom maps.All that being said, it's just a mod, and it doesn't cost anything, so there isn't much of a detriment for playing it. Honestly, give it a try, and 15 minutes later you'll be able to form your own opinion.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 16, 2016
												While its not THAT BAD, its still pretty bad.If you're expecting a story like the other Half-Life games, you aren't going to find it here. The story in this game doesn't make any canonical sense. It implies that before the events of the Black Mesa Incident, there were places where these aliens could be found beyond Xen, and that humans had been turned into headcrab zombies before. The physics puzzles in this game are annoying as hell too. You have to push these really heavy boxes while you're getting attacked by at least 5 aliens so that you can climb to the next area, its annoying as hell. On top of that, there are also soldiers that are apparently helping the aliens to make sure you don't get the crystal, as if it didn't get any more confusing. Oh but it gets better, the final boss is apparently supposed to be a younger version of the Nihilanth from Half-Life 1. It has the laziest AI I've ever seen - it just chases you in circles and it has a barnacle tounge that you cannot escape from, and if he gets you, you have to watch the entire cutscene where he spawns again. At that point I just said ♥♥♥♥ it and stopped playing.TL;DR - Don't play it.
